fire sword shall raze eating age come death vncertaine houre onely bodie hath power yet shall better part transcend skie immortall name shall neuer die wheresoere romane eagle spread conquering wing shall read wee prophet truly diuine liuing fame shall euer shine ierom like manner one epistle writeth perpetuity funerall elegie made himselfe deare memorie beloued fabiola buried citie bethlem said volumini subdidi vt quocun que noster sermo peruenerit te laudatam te bethlem condita lector agnoscat varus tribune rome hath beene longer remembred martial epigram lib ep euer hee could haue beene funerall monument lately made thus speake english varus rome tribune didst command hundred men renownd aegypt land stranger ghost thou dost remaine nilus shore promisd rome vaine could dew teares thy dying face thy said funerall flame odour grace yet verse eternizd shalt thou bee false egypt cannot cousen thee thus lucan lib owne verse caesar victorie pharsalia great sacred worke poesy thou freest fate giust eternity mortall wight caesar enuy liuing name romane mus ought may promise thee whilest homer honoured future time shalt thou bee read age shall v darke oblivion staine pharsalia euer shall remaine bookes mus workes monument permanent thing else vicissitude change city nation may thus reade ouids metamorphosis lib wee see generall nation gather strength others fall troy rich powerfull proudly stood could ten yeares spend streames bloud building onely old ruines showes rich tombes slaughtered fire inclose sparta mycenae greece flower cecrops citie amphions towres glorious kingdomes euen men doe die bellay ruines rome translated spenser make demonstration shew citie strange countrey man traueller thou stranger rome rome seekest nought rome rome perceiust old wall old arch thou seest old palace rome men call behold wreake ruine wast mighty power tamd world hath tamd selfe last prey time thing doth deuoure rome rome onely funerall onely rome rome hath victorie ne wayes sings thus ruines citie thou sawst verlam head aloft reare cinder lie sadly buried alabaster tuch porphery adornd welneare pride great troinouant scornd likewise vpon forgotten citie namelesse late writer hath made epitaph stay thy foot passest wonder descry church interrd dead themselues sepulchred house men slept wakt ash vnderrakt word allude corne troy stood fully home haue here citie graue reader wonder thinke city thus would die like men yet wonder thinke none many city thus gone conclude chapter two stanzaes following taken spenser poeme aforesaid speaking vanity prince absolon like thinke gaine perpetuitie death erecting pillar like monument keepe name remembrance onely mus work giue unto man immortality vaine earthly prince vaine seeke pyramides heauen aspired huge colosses built costly paine brasen pillar neuer bee fired shrine made metall desired make memory euer liue mortall immortalitie giue deed doe die euer nobly done thought men doe themselues decay wise word taught number runne recorded mus liue aye ne may storming showres washt away ne bitter breathing windes harmfull blast age enuie shall euer wast chap ii funerall monument graues tombes sepulchre fittingly called muniments defend fence corp defunct otherwise might haue beene pulled graues sauage brutishnesse wilde beast none buried townes city either field along high way side put passenger entombe dead within citie seldome bone ash trajan emperour put golden vrne set marketplace vpon top pillar one whole peece one hundred fourty foot high galbaes bodie long neglected saith tacitus darke burie dead without gate townes city custome time old saith men woman buried owne priuate house within owne priuate garden afterwards noysome savour contagious stinke dead carkases interred enacted burial bee without townes city conuenient place appointed purpose howsoeuer order obserued gentile upon reason onely scilicet vt vrbibus mundicies seruaretur aer minus inficeretur ex cadauerum putrescentium faetore yet true christian liuely faith adopted child god mysterie manner interment carriage buriall dead corp without citie wall publikely confirme witnesse party deceased gone world bee made free denizons another citie namely heauen remaine blessed saint eternall happinesse order custome buriall without city continued amongst christian vntill time gregory great monkes frier priest saith foresaid authour began offer sacrifice soules departed easie greater profit procured first place sepulture bee adioyning vnto church afterwards got licence burie within church vpon reason said gregory q cap cum grauia peccata non deprimunt saith hee tunc prodest mortuis si ecclesijs sepeliantur quia eorum proximi quoties ad eadem sacrum loca veniunt suorumque sepulturam aspiciunt recordantur pro eis domino preces fundunt panuinius lideritu sepeliend mortuos antiquitus tantum extra vrbem coemiterijs hominu corpus sepeliebantur pace ecclesiae data intra vrbes ad templorum limen postea etiam ipsis templis sepeliri mo inualuit constantinus porticu templi apostolorum constantinopoli honorius porticu templi petri romae eius vxor intra idem templum sepulti sunt anciently body dead buried onely without city coemiteries sleeping place vntill resurrection word signifies persecution ended peace giuen christian church manner grew vse burie within city entrance sacred temple yea afterwards verie church themselues constantine buried porch apostle constantinople honorius porch peter rome wife empresse within said church come nearer home austine first archbishop canterbury sent hither foresaid gregory interred porch saint peter paul commonly called saint austin neare vnto canterbury religious house owne foundation together sixe archbishop next succeeded whose reliques afterwards remoued abbey church shall speake hereafter cuthbert cudbright theleuenth archbishop province obtained pope dispensation making coemiteries churchyard within townes city whereas england vntill time within wall thereof none buried following word appendix booke rochester ms sir robert cotton librarie cutbertus archiepiscopus cant xi ab augustino cum romae videret plures intra ciuitates sepeliri rogauit papam ut sibi liceret coemiteria facere quod papa annuit reuersus itaque coemiteria vbique anglia fieri constituit order buriall thus begun england likewise followed grauestones made tombes erected inscription engrauen upon continue remembrance party deceased succeeding age called epitaph epitaph superscription either verse prose astrict pithie diagram writ carued engrauen vpon herald office robert monke gloucester old rimer writes language father foure hundred yeares since doth summarily thus tell ioseph planted luciu established doctrine christ kingdome britaine liues say neither strong smooth yet perhaps may giue palate variety like shall haue hereafter lucie coeles sone aftur hym kyng fore hym engelond chrestondom non na heard hurde ofte miracle rome meny anothur stede yat thurgh christene men come wilnede anon hys herte take fong christendom therfor messagers wyth good letter chose nom pape eleutherie hasteliche wende yat hym menne xpendom sende yat myghte servy god wilned muche therto seyd wold noght glad er hit wer ydo although tho ye pape hurde thes el anus medu inus two learned clerk sent lu ius rome twey h ly men sende phagan damian hys soul amende ryghte beleue teche yaf xpendom folke faste aboute wide ther com thys hundryd sixti yer aftur god ybore dede ydoo thus come lo xpendom brutayne lond ther wer erst som preneliche xpendom de fond atte plas glastyngbury ioseph arimathie liued ther christes lay wyth hij companie ther wer tho brutayne false lawes lere eyght twenty chese stedes byshopriches thre erchtemples hit wer heyghest echon eleutherie sende huder furst chrestendom xiii pape aftur peter com descyples yat huder sende xpendom bring lefte wildernesse aftur hure prechyng men name h clupeth glastyngbury desert tho ther come flourished booke calleda manus sir robert cotton library vox clamantis cry clergiemen time first quod christi scholam dogmatizant eius contrarium operantur quod potentiores alijs existunt quod carnalia appetentes vltra modum delicate vinunt quod lucris terrenis inhiant honore prelacie gaudent non vt prosint sed vt presint episcopatum desiderant quod legibus positi quae quamuis ad cultum anime necessarie non sunt infinitas tamen constitutiones quasi quotidie ad eorum lucrum nobis grauiter impon quod bona temporalia possidentes spiritualia omittunt quod christus pacem suis discipulis dedit reliquit sed prelati propter bona terrena guerras contra christianos legibus suis positiuis instituunt prosequuntur quod cleri sunt bellicosi quod scribunt docent ea quae sunt pacis sed contrarium ea quae sunt belli procurant quod nomen sanctum sibi presumunt appropriant tamen sibi terrena nec alijs inde participando ex caritate subueniunt quod intrant ecclesiam per symoniam quod honores non onera prelacie plures affectant quo magi ecclesia cessant virtutes vitia multipliciter accrescunt quod rectores curis residentes cu tamen negligentes venationibus praecipue voluptatibus penitus intendunt quod presbyteri sine curis siue stipendarij non propter mundici ordinis honestatem sed propt r mundi otia gradum presbyteratus appetunt assumunt much speakes abuse vice churchman epistle sine titulo namelesse friend wherein anatomises romane clergie thus translated epist venus wanton toyes honourd base baud boyes adulterie whoredome incest honourd among best counted sport enemye christ law generall counsail made also refused denyed forsaken wherfore thintente men may know abhominable wrong noble gracious prynce doth susteyne vnlawfull intreatyngs therfore article hereafter following presented vnto shall desyre knowe truth truth shall thyrste couet feythfully assyst maynteyn supporte defende stand theyr prynce souerayn iust lawfull right wise cause first generall counsail lawfully gathered ought superiour iurisdictions either vsurped suffred papall iustly holden king matter concernyng feythe direction whole churche christe also ought iudged thereby decree none consonant law christe secondly prynces two wayes principally none prevayle attaine right thone thother say caw concernyng sowle beyng mere spirituell appellacion generall counsail temporall caw sword except mediation frends matter may compounded whosoeuer wolde go take away naturell defense prynces manly withstood prince subiects therto christien men shuld anymated word lord iesu christe obey ye prynces aboue theyr deputyes mynysters gevyng powre forreyns wythin theyr rule domynyons thirdly dyuers generall counsaills haue determyned caw strife controuersie beyng one begonne regyon shall sayd regyon finally determyned elsewhere vpon grounde king highnes noble spirituell temporall common one hole consent vpon diuers prudent wyse polytike reason weyghty consideracions agreable seyd generall counsaills haue made law good people lyving within lymets true lawfull matrymonye shall malice evill long deteyned interrupted ryght tymes passyd haue byn neither vnlawfull matrymonye shall haue iniust incestuous demoure contynuance delayes rome wont haue may evydently appere prynces weyghtye long protracted cause matrymonye hath finall prosperous end accordyng lawes god briefe successe issue alredy like follow lawdes god thonly werker forthely sayd prynce soueraigne accordyng libertie lawes nature constitucions generall counsaills afore hath prouoked appeled iniust vnlawfull sentence wrongfully geuen bushop rome generall counsaill next ensying lawfully congregate say sentence vsurper goddes lawes infringer generall counsells callyth himselfe pope fulminate set forthe sayd vsurper ought abhorred despysed manfully withstood defended doen shall haue theyr bukler latter better parte verse ensuyng maligner forparte quoniam qui malignant people blyndnes prynces theyr supportacion hetherto hath susteyned doyng themselffs thereby great iniurye wrong thought therfore conuenyent also moche necessarye open vnto people thyntent shulde henceforth longer disteyned honouryng idoll man vsurpyng goddes powre auctoryte man neither life learnyng conuersacion like christ minister disciple yea man also though see apostolike neuer high beatorum marty um qui suum christo sanguinem fuderunt merita diuine laudis exultatione celebranda sint foundacion albans abbey eorumque dei auxilio exempla gloriosa consequenda precipue tamen nobis beatissimi albani qui sub hac britannie insula gloriosus martyrio effulsit memoria pia semper intentione et sedula sollicitudine obseruanda est vnde ego offa gratia dei rex merciorum cum filio meo egfrido pro amore omnipotentis dei huius sancti intercessione terram xxx manentium locis quorum subinferuntur nomina domino meo iesu christo ad ecclesiam sancti albani vbi ipse tyro primus passione victima effectus est iure perpetuo perdonabo eoque deleclabilius hanc donationem perficio quia superna protectio tam nobilem temporibus nostris thesaurum qui diu fuit clausus et huius terre indigenis abditus reuelare dignata est hec itaque supradictarum vocabula terrarum et wineslawe xii manentium cum terminis suis et stelsdune sine b ldinistotum trium manentium quorum scilicet trium manentium terminus sunt hij suanaburna heortmere stretreolab item vero x manentium vbi dicitur senecaulilan vel feutun cum sylua que cognominatur lioropuda cum terminis suis et lystune v manentium quam videlicet terram albumundus abbas expeditionem subterfugiens mihi reconciliacionis gracia dabat et quia ipse martyr almifluus caput et exemplum christianitatis omnis britannie indubitanter habetur dignum est vt locus quo sanctum corpus eius requiescit et ab omni populo veneratur speciali qua dam et singulari priuilegij libertate per no honoretur hoc igitur con letter u episcopis et abbatibus ducibus et principibus mei sub inuo ione sancle trinitatis indiuidue vnitatis donando precipio vt ecclesia ancti albani omnisque possessio nunc et futuris temporibus illi subdita mper sit libera et quieta ab omni tributo et necessitate seu regis seu episcopi ducis indicis et exactorum et operum que iudici solent neque emendatione pontium neque fossam adversum immicos faciendam totum omne prefatur terre stipendium et exactio ad supradicti martyris tumbam insolubiliter persoluatur statuo etiam et cum fidelium meorum assensi confirmo vt episcopi vel eorum ministrinudam aliquatenus super ipsam ecclesiam vel super perochiales ecclesias eidem quibuscunque temporibus subiacentes nisi tantummodo cum advocati fuerint dedicandi vel paschali solennitate sanctum chrisma et oleum ex tribuendi potestatem habeant ec earum presbiteros ad sinodum suam vel capitulum conuocare vel ab officio diuino suspendere seu aliquod eos vel minimum ius exercere presumant sed omnia quecunque ecclesie sancte fuerint abbatis solummodo usdem monasterij potestati tractanda libere subiaceant de censu quoque singulis annis per vniuersam britanniam colligendo et sacre romane ecclesie pro slabilitate regni nostri et salute communi transmittendo decernimus vt quantum terra sancti martyris peruenerit ab hijs quibus iniunctum fuerit ab abbate vndecunque collectum nullatenus alias asportetur sed aliari sancti albani fideliter oblatum ad vtilitatem eiusdem eccles e secundum quod abbas decreuerit inviolabiliter expendatur esi forte quis intra eiusdem ecclesie protestatem aut exitum cum episcopo seu abbate inveniatur bello surto vel fornicacione aut alio quolibet simili reatu astrictus semper par pene et emendacionis que regi episcopo committi debetur ad beati albani monasterium inviolato semper federe reddatur credo enim et vera iter consido quod hec munificentia non solum mihi meisque sed etiam vniuersis anglorum populis summopere prodesse uult quia pro eius amore ille mile intrepidus meruit coronari qui totius mundi pericula passus est suo sanguine expiare si autem quod absit vspiam quis laruarico attactus instinctu nte subdola hec machinatus fuerit annullare vel quippiam penis quod consti uimus transuertere sua pro audacia cetu hac vita anathematizetur fidelium et tremendo dei examine astantibus celorum agminibus hominum que turmis nec non et horrendis herebi vermulis palam cunctis damxetur cum hedis auerni cruciamenta sine fine lucturus ni ante obitum condigne emendauerit hec sunt nomina qui hanc donationem meam consentientes signo crucis christi confirmauerunt ego offa rex huic donationi mee signum crucis impono ego egfridus paterne munificentie consentiens subscripst ego higberht archiepiscopus consensi subscripst ego ceelnulf episcopus consensi ego hethered church rufford nottinghamshire booke said house sede pater summa disponit secula cuncta patre genitus creat regit omnia natu omnia vi ificat procedens spiritus almus flamma calor pruna tria sunt hec re sed vna sic ab igne calor non diuiditur neque fulgor ast vnitis vnus subsi lit ignis sic pater natus spiritus sed deus vnus huic laude munus qui regnat trinus vnus huic laus et doxa nunc et per secula cuncta vnder picture christ crucified nec deus est nec homo presens quam cerno figura et deus est et homo que signat sacrum figura verus homo verusque deus tamen vnus vterque probra crucis patitur mortem su et sepelitur viuit item crucis hic per signa triumphat ab hoste id notum nobis crucis huius litera reddit scilicet ipsius nota sunt c ux et crucifixus hec et ego veneror iesumquoque semper adore againe vnder crucifix quantum pro nobis christus tulit ecce videmus et tamen lachrymis heu lumen sicca tenemus vnder picture christ vsually abbey church effigiem christi dum transis semper honora non tamen effigiem sed quem designat adora nam deus est quod imago docet sed non deus ipsa hanc videas et mente cola quod cernis illa sum rex cunctorum caro factus amore reorum ne desperetis venie dum tempus habetis picture christ speaking thus man agonie passion aspice mortalis fuit vnquam pa talis peccatum sperne pro quo mea vulnera cerne aspice qui transis quia tu mihi causa doloris thus exhorting man amendment life aspice serue deisic posi ere iudei aspice deuote quoniam sic pendeo pro aspice mortalis pro te datur hostia talis roitum vite reddo tibi redde mihi te cruce sum pro te qui peccas desine pro desine veniam dic culpam corrige vitam knight templers came house called temple house holborne southampton place chappell representation christ sepulchre verse brought ierusalem vita mori voluit et hoc tumulo requieuit mors quia vita fuit nostram victrix aboleuit nam qui confregit nigra inferna ille subegit educen suos cuius dux ipse cohortis tartarus inde gemit et mors lugens spoliatur another inscription vpon hac sub clausura recubat christi caro puro sub cura semper stat nostra figura est deus hic tantus natus de vigine quantus militie caput hic mundi medicena iacet hic another sum deus ex quo carnem sumsi sed sine neuo lebs mea ligno fixit pendente maligno aspice plasma tuum qui transis ante sepulchrum qui triduo iacui cum pro te passus obiui quid pro pateris aut quae mihi grata rependis sum deus et puluis sed regnes si modo serues pro te passus ita tu pro prospera vita pro te plagatus pro tu pelle reatus vpon picture holy lambe mortuus et viuus idem sum pastor et agnus hic agnus mundum instaurat sanguine lapsum many altar england consecrated blessed virgine mary christ ny picture statue many church erected dedicated holinesse many exorbitant honour due onely blessed sauiour attributed heauenly deitie appeare inscription numberlesse altar celo lata no seruet virgo beata sede locata pia nostri memor esto maria que super astra manet lapsorum vulnera sanet que celo floret pro nobis omnibus oret sit nobis grata virgo super astra leuata os mente pia pro nobis virgo maria virgo dei genetrix sit nobis auxiliatrix stella maria mari succurre pijssima nobis virgo dei digna poscentibus esto benigna mater virtutis det nobis dona salutis liberet pena no celi porta serena virgo maria tuos serva sine crimine servo virginis auxilium foueat no nunc et euum virgo fecunda pia tu no crimine munda no benedic grata pia mater et inviolata no iuuet illud ave per quam patet exitus virgo salutata iuuet omnes prole beata no gabriele nata saluet partu grauidata virginis intacte cum veneris ante figuram pretereundo caue ne sileatur ave sol penetrat vitrum penetratur nec violatur sic virgo peperit nec violata fuit hac non vade via nisi dicas ave maria semper sit sine qui mihi dicit aueiuxta aram virginis fano arenae patauiis regina lucis almae syderum intacta parens puerpera virgo salutisque nostre digna propago parce iam parce mitissima quaeso hanc animam christo redde benigna et miserere canentis osanna salutation virgo salutatur verboque dei grauidatur nec grauat intactum gremium verbum caro factum virgo parens humilisque deo cara sibi viles uem calcauit que prima superbia strauit nativity christ virgo parit puerum lumen de lumine verbum est vox celestis lux celica stellaque testis church corpus christi commonly inscription following hic est cibus qui plene icit non corpus sed animam non ventr sed mentem si quis ex hoc comederit viuet eternum panis mutatur specie remanente priore sed non est talis qualis sentitur ore re occultatur quare nam si videatur unc abhorreres manducare timeres panis mutatur carnem sic operatur christus ipse verum sub pane latens caro verbum portraiture soure euangelists mat luc iohannesper euangelica dictum deleantur nostra delicta euangelicis armis muniat no conditor orbis euangelica lectio sit nobis salus protecti fo euangelij repleat no dogmate celi que eque naturas retinent nec vtrique figuras sic act christi describunt quatuor isti queque b obscuris de christo dictum figuris aperire datur o ipse notatur neare altar consecrated saint de venie munus nobis rex trinus et vnus virga virens iesse no verum ducat ad esse obi portus ad vitam virginis ortus sumamus portum vite per virginis ortum vite portu saluemur virginis ortu ortus solamen det nobis virginis amen no ditet venia sanctissima virgo maria no rege summe pater no integra protege mater no ope conforta celorum fulgida porta no famulos serva genetrix morte proterva nosiungat thronis veri thronus salomonis ad fontem venie ducat no dextra marie ad celi decoranos transfer virgo decora impetret genito nobis veniam pia virgo turmis angelicis societ no conditor orbis ordo phrophetarum minuat penas animarum cetus apostolicus sit nobis semper amicus martyribus sisti facia o gratia christi grex confessorum purget peccata reorum virginci flores nostros delete dolores no reg no muni sanctis deus omnibus vni indulgence pardon granted bishop rome certaine church altar likewise depensild vpon wall forme followeth alexander episcopus seruus seruorum dei vniuersis christi sidelibus presentibus futuris salutem apostolicam benedictionem louse ad ne paragraph r e sideles muni icenti nostre dextram debeamus extendere debitricem maxime tamen spiritualis gratie prerogatiua no decet illos ollere dignioribus beneficentie nostre fauoribus ampliare qui se nobis r f feruentiori deuotione exibent fide stabile opere sideli er ffi ace sane igitur cupientes vt ecclesia ia c preementioribus frequentetur noribus vt christi ideles eo libentius de otionis causa conslu nt ad e dem manusque ad conseruationemeius dein prompti porrigentes adiutrices quo ex inde dono celestis nostri iesu christi vespera vigilie ipsius v que ad vesperam eiusdem diei dictam ia c ecclesiam deuote visitauerint annuatim et manus adeius conseruationem por exerint adiutrices plenam omnium suorum crosse many oder bodyes seintis ye xix yere pardon many karynes pope nicholas iiii saint gregory eche theym graunted therto x yere pardon many karynes thassencyon lorde crystmas ye haue xiiii yere pardon many karyns thred parte synnes relesyd item chirche saint sebastian wythout towne plase pope calixt named tolund aungell appered spack gregory pope place foryefenes synnes penaunce high auter graunted xxviii c yere pardon many karynes cometh furst auter stondith chirche hath xiiii c yere pardon sellare vaute wherin lyeth buryed xlix pope deyed martyr whoo cometh fyrste place delyueryth viii soules purgatory soche moste desyreth moche pardon therto worlde nombre ne reken euery sonday ye delyuer soul purgatory sellare stondith pytt saint peter saint poule hyd ccl yere noo man wyst thei com puttyth hed pytte takyth ageyne clene synne pope gregory siluester pope nicholas pope pelagius pope honorius eche theym graunted place one yere pardon many karyns lyeth body dyvers oder holy persones long write grace saint sebastians groundyd taken away item chirche saynt mary mayor afore writen afore quyer ymage lady whiche seint luke peynt ymage seynt gregory dyd bere mary mayor saint peter thapostle also comyng afore castell saint aungell see aungell hyght castell havyng honde burninge sworde hym gret multytude aungels whiche songe afore ymage regina celi letare c answering saynt gregory os pro nobis deum alleluia item chirche saint iohn latryneus pope siluestre yas therto many yere pardon reyned droppes water day halowed chirche tyme reyned sore noo man seen greater rayne day whan graunted thought hym selfe whedyr much power ther came voyce heuen sayd siluestre thou hast power inough yeue pardon god graunted thus moche therto man made vowe iherusalem lacked good doo pilgramage yf go saint peter chirch saint iohn latrynes shal discharged haue absolucyon promise ony tyme man cometh saint iohn latrynes quitt synnes penaunce penitent synnes blyssed moder bereth chylde heryth masse saturdayes saint iohn latrynes delyvaryd theym desyreth purgatory nombre lxxvii soules item vpon tour chirch stondyth double crosse made swerde saint iohn beheded euery tyme man beholdith crosse hath xiiii yere pardon many karynes penaunce high auter ye haue remishion sinnes penance innumerable pardon nedeth hymselfe y graue seynt iohn layd hym selfe whan sayd masse come gret lyght ouer graue whan light goon funde noo tynge hevynly bred graue cometh euery good fryday night ye holy creame oyle putteth therein hed hath cm yere pardon many karyns behynde high auter stondith cheyr god sat whoo sitteth therein hath iii parte alle hys synnes relesyd visite alle odir aulters hath eche auter xliiii c yere pardon many karynes oon side chirche ther sacryfice seynt iohn baptist aulter hedys seynt peter poule hed zacharie prophet fader iohn baptist wyth dyuers odyr reliquys item chirchyard stondith chapel y callid sanctum sanctorum face lord may ye haue xiiii yere pardon many karynes whan emperour constantyne christened tho spake pope siluestre geuen hous wurschip god graunt mekely grace willingly come towne thoo answerd pope siluestre lord ihu criste gret mercy hath purged gret lazarye mut purge alle visityth chyrch synne penance woll beleue may goo seynt latrynes quyer dore may see marbill wryten seynt iohns day vnto scrouetyd pardon doubled fro scrouetide vnto gladnes celebrate devowtely solenly keped grete infenite nombre cristen pepull cowrte rome ower saide holie fader pope well consideryng infenite nombre cristen peple bothe spyrituall temporall inforceth hymselfe alle hys myght strenght subuert vtterly destroye holye religion souerayne criste nott vnknowen late sayd cruell enemy hath opteyned goten grete myght power many dyuers grete citees consideryng holynes hymselfe sufficyent ne power resiste withstonde forsayd gret malyces porposes without ayde helpe cristen peple hath statu ed ordeyned graunted pastorall power conteyned thes article following furst ower soueraigne lorde kyng herry seuenth progeny archebusschoppes busschoppes abbotts duke erles baron knygtes squyers gentillmen yomen cetezines stranger oder cristen peple men woman oder degre condicyon soeuer thei spyrituall temporall seculer reguler dwellyng tyme abydyng within relme englond irelond wale gernesey garnsey oder place vndre rewle dominacion sayd prothonotarie doctor diuinite sayd holy fader pope imbassator holy iubeley commissarie oder hym substituted deputed ther put chest thentent ordeyned soche somme quantite money gold siluer lymytted taxed folowyng last end paper spent defence ower feithe shall indulgence pardon grace remissyon ther sinnes whiche thei shuld thei gone personally rome yere grace ther vesited chorches assigned entent within cite without alsoo done oder thing required done ther obteyning said grace ubeley also said holy fader hath gevyn full power auctorite said commissarie deputis che e assigne confessours penitenciers seculer reguler soche place shall please said commissarie deputy confession soche desposed receyue pardon holy iubeley confessours penitenciers shall auctorite power euery behalfe whiche penitenciers rome rome yere grace saye thei shall absolue manner crime trespass trangressyons synnes euer thei though absolutyon ther reserved courte rome pope himselfe nothyng except soche except petenciers rome absolucyon conspiratours person holy fader pope state see rome also falsaries pope bull oder wrytings passing courte rome seller conveyer harneys oder thing prohibited hethen peple thes laieth violente bondes busschoppes oder prelate chirche busschoppes said confessours shall haue power geue graunte said persones confessyd contrite clene full remission whiche called pena et culpa also said confessours penitenciers shall power auctorite dispence change manner vowes alm sdede defence feith none except though itt rome iherusalem seint iames also said holy fader willing man excluded grete grace indulgence hath graunted soche seke impotente oderwyse deseased yei may easly visitte chorches assigned visetted shall ther howsholde sayd indulgence remissyon grace well visitte sayd chorches furst compownding effectually sayd commissarie deputy also itt y graunted sayd holy fader tho rome last yere grace shalbe parteable capax sayd grace pardon yt thei receive itt also sayd holy fader hath graunted said commissarie substitute full power interpretate declare soche doubt may fownde moved thies graunts execucion parte ther willyng commandyng ther interpretatyon shall effectually taken stond also said holy fader hath straitly commanded vertue obedience vndre payne cursyng sentence behalfe gevin whiche may nott assoyled pope furst satisfaccion made sayd commissarie depute qualite trespas none ordinary seculer reguler oder persones seculer reguler lett bulles oder writyngs made declaracion published chorches citees diocesses wher whan itt shalbe nedefull thei shall aske receyve though itt offered money oder reward publicacion sufferance therof otherwyse lett hynder thexpedicion therof goodspeede seid indulgence persuade directly indirectly person withdrawe good mynd porpose behalfe also seid holy fader chargeth commandeth prechers word god whate condicion euer thi well men religyon oder thei shall publishe effectually declare ther prechings oder place whan thei shall required seid commissarie deputees seid indulgence pardon vndre peyne specifyed also seid holye fader hath suspended disanulled manner pardon graunts graunted graunted notwithstondyng specyall clause thei shulde revolted without specyall mentyon made de verbo verbum tax euery man shall put chest woll receyve grete grace iubeley furst euery man woman degre condicioun state soeuer thei yf archebusschoppe duke oder dignite spirituall temporall havyng londes yerely valour l aboue must pay cause payed holy enrent effecte defence feithe agaynst grete cruell enemy turke yf thei receiue grete indulgence grace iubeley themselfs wyfes child maryed effectually without disseyte put chest ordeyned entent trew lawfull money countrie wher thei iii l vii viii also euery man woman havyng tenementes rente yerely value one l aboue summe ii l exclusive must pay themselfs wyfes xl item tho hath londes rente c yerely valour ccccl aboue summe l exclusive must pay themselfes wyfes xxvi viii item tho hath londes rente c yerely valour ccl aboue summe ccccl exclusive must pay themselfs c xiii iiii item tho haue londes rente c yerely valour one cl aboue yerely valour ccl exclusiue must pay themse f c vi viii item tho haue londes rente c yerely valour xl l aboue summe one cl exclusive must pay themselfs c ii vi item tho haue londes rente c yerely valour xx l summe xl l exclusive must pay themselfs c xvi item men religion havyng londes rent tenement yerely valour ii l aboue must pay themselfs couent xl item tho hath londes rent c yerely valour one l aboue yerely valour exclusive must pay themselfs couent vl iiii item tho londes rente c yerely valour cccccl aboue valour one l exclusive must pay couent iii l vi viii item tho hath londes rente yerely valour iicl aboue summe ccccl exclusive must pay themselfs couent xx item tho hath londes rent yerely valour xl l aboue summe cl must pay themselfs couent x item seculer men wemen hath londes rent yerely valour xl l vndre whose mouable goodes extendyth valour l must pay themselfs wyfes xl item tho who goodes mouable extendyth ccccl aboue summe one l exclusive must pay themselfs wyfes vi viii item tho who good mouable extendyth valour ccl aboue summe ccccl must pay themselfs ther wyfes vii vi item tho who goodes mouable within valour ccl vndre xx l must pay themselfs ther wyfes child married xii item tho who goodes mouable extendyth nott valour xx l shall pay themselfs ther wyfes child shall please devocyon article bull dispensacyon simony vsury goodes wrongfully keped reserued commissary moreouer gaspar pow orator commissary absolue dispence manner persones dwellyng abidyng within seyd relme place aboue rehersyd men wemen degre condicyon euer thei spirytuall temporall seculer reguler whiche hath commytted symony gevyng recevyng holy order benefice spiritual wai thei may notwithstondyng seyd simony commyttid ministre order receyved benefice obteyned lawfully kepe occupye frutes receyved occupie despose plesure yf seyd persones reason therof runne irregularite ther apon syngyng masse oder wyse ministryng holy sacramentys chirche seyd commissary hath full power despence irregularite take away infamye vnablenes whiche thei reason alway prouyded seyd persones make composytyon herof seyd commissarie soche money thei compownd effectually pay seyd commissarie spent holy vse relefe defence feith also seyd commissarie hath power compownd absolue dispence tho occupye evill goten good vsurers soche wrongfully vnlefully occupieth witholdeth oder mennys good fyndyng good hidde knowyng dowtyng owner seyd good thei shulde mak restitucyon thei lefully kepe occupie good furst makyng composycyon seyd commyssarie certeyne summe money spent foreseyd holy vse sey relefe defence namelesse author written latine three hundred yeares since translated english one william marshall imprinted london one robert wyer ann king henry eighth booke called defence peace tymes apostlesd fence pe ce chap nombre preestes beyng notablye augmented increased saith avoyde sclaundre occasyon offendynge man avoyde scisme dyvysion preestes chose one among themselues shulde dyrecte ordre touchynge exercysynge ecclesiasticall offyce service dystrybutyng oblacyons dysposynge orderynge thyngs conuenient maner n leste yf euery man myght thinge owne pleasure lest himselfe good ordre servyce church myght troubled reason dyuerse affeccions men preeste whiche elected chosen ordre rule preestes custome vsed maner speakynge came afterwards onely called bysshop ouerseer onely ouerloker christen people whiche cause preests also called ouerseers prymatyne church also ouersyght preestes howsoeuer saith chapter essentyall inseparable auctoryte dygnyte preesthood bysshops preheminence aboue preestes onely auctoryte accydentall bishop provydence god chosen vpon former reason rule gouernment clergie within diocesse power auctoryte makyng admynystryng sacrament performing duty belonginge meerely preesthood preestes saith one auctoryte kynde neyther bysshop rome bysshop hath auctoryte whyt largely hath euer beynge called symple pryvate preest therfore mervayled wherfore men stryve styffely frowardly affyrmynge yet thynge reasonably pope rome hath large power keyes geuen hym chryste hath preesteseuery priest hath much power binding loosing pope seing cannot proued holy scrypture rather contrary whiche thyngs go author euidently seene perceyved ought vnderstande knowe two wordes presbyter episcopus saye preest senyour bysshop one sygnyfycacion betokened one thynge prymatyue church albeit put sygnyfy one thynge diuers propertyes presbyter name gyven age moche saye senyour elder episcopus name gyuen cure charge vpon moche say ouerloker according saynt iherom certayne epystle euandre sayth thus presbyter episcopus one name age dygnyte dignified priest meane bishop euer since conquest chiefe seate chaire city church haue euer since sunneshine gospell beene basilicae gentile large spacious haul wherein magistrate sat iudgement ministred iustice conuerted christian church whence ausonius wrote thus basilica olim negotijs plenum c basilica haul iustice certaine cathedrall collegiate church set wne aduice counsell number rule statute obserued officer minister residing appeares record following thought transcribe henricus octauus dei gracia anglie paragraph francie et hibernie rex fidei defensor ac terra supremum ecclesie anglicane et hibernie caput vniuersis sancte matris ecclesie silijs ad quorum noticiam presens scriptum peruenerit salutem cumet nobis et regni nostri preceribus vniuer soque senatui qu parliamentum vocamus visum sit deo et confidimus no huc mouente monasteria que passim regno nostro extabant tum propter graues et multiplices illorum enormitates tum ob alias iustas rationabilesque causa supprimere olere et meliores vsus convertere no et diuine voluntati conformius ius christiana esseducentes vt vbi ignorantia et superstitio regnabant ibi sincerus dei cultus vigeat et sanctum christi euangelium assidue et pure annuncietur et preteria vt ad christiane fidei ac pietatis incrementum iuuentus regni nostri bonis literis instituatur et pauperes perpetuo sustententur ipsorum monasteriorum loco ecclesias ereximus et con ituimus quarum alias cathedrales alias collegiatas vocari volumus pro quarum ecclesiarum ac collegiorum gubernaecione et regimine leges et statuta que sequntur prescribend curauimus quibus tam decani et vtriusque ordinis canonici quam ceteri omnes ministri pueri et pauperes qui ipsis ecclesijs commoraturi sunt pareant et ebsequantur eisque vt nobis conditis et perfect regantur et gubernentur id quod si fecerint ingens sine pictatis incrementum hoc regno nostro peruenturum esse confidemus et no expectatione voto nostro qui ad dei optumi maximi gloriam ac fidei christiane augmentum ecclesias ereximus et varijs ministrorum ordinibus enornauimus ha quaquam fraudabimus dat c reported said thomas becket himselfe banishment blessed lady gaue golden eagle full precious ointment inclosed stone vessell commanding preserue foretelling withall king england therewith anointed strong champion stout defendours church bountifull benigne fortunate peaceably recouer land territory beene lost predecessours long eagle viall sacred vessell custody telling withall hee bee martyr vision happened forsooth sen france nunnes church consecrated saint columbe citie hee found pope alexander third man like himselfe ambitious turbulent ierie spirit whose bosome saith hollinshead emptied whole cartload complaint grieuances like contumacious rebell soueraigne lord excommunicating cursing bell booke candle way adhere vnto king partie returne word hee expresse strange incredible apparition set downe language found anciently written lieger booke abbey whalley lanchishire thus begin quando ego thomas cantuar archiepiscopus exul ab anglia fugie bam ad franciam veni ad papam alex qui tunc senonis erat vt ei ostenderem malas consuetudines abusiones quas rex anglie ecclesiam troducebat wholly end ing purpose quadam nocte cum essem ecclesia sancte columbe monial rogaui reginam virginum vt daret regi anglie et hered propositum et voluntatem emendandi se erga ecclesiam et quod christus pro sua miserecordia ampliori dilectione ipsum faceret diligere ecclesiam statim apparuit mihi beata virgo habens pectore istam aquilam auream siue lapideam accipiens aquilam de pectore suo ampullam includit aquilam cum ampulla manu mea posuit et hec verba per ordinem dixit ista est vnctio per quam reges anglie debent inungi non isti qui modo sunt regnant regnabunt quia maligni sunt propter peccata sua multa amiserunt amitterent sunt autem reges anglie futuri qui inungerentur vnctione benigni pugiles ecclesie erunt nam isti terram amissam parentibus pacisice recuperabunt donec aquilam cum ampulla habeant est autem rex anglorum futurus qui primo mungeretur vnctione ista qui terram amissam parentibus scilicet normanniam aquitaniam recuperabit sine vi rex iste erit maximus inter reges est ille qui edificabit multas ecclesias terra sanctum fugabit omnes paganos de babilon adem ecclesias edi icabit plures quotiescunque rex portabit aquilam pectore victoriam habebit de inimicis suis paragraph regnum eius semper augmentabitu tu autem e martyr futurus tunc rogaui beatam virginem vt ostenderet mihi vbi custodirem tam preciosum sanctuarium que dixit mihi est vir ciuitate isla willielmus monachus sancti cipriani pictauie eiectus iniuste ab abbate suo de abbachia sua qui rogat papam vt abbatem suum compellat vt eum abbachiam suam reducat trade sibi aquilam cum ampulla vt eam ad ciuitatem pictauie portet et ecclesia sancti gregorij que est iuxta ecclesiam sancti hillarij eam abscondat capite ecclesie versus occidentem sub lapide magno ibi inuenietur tempore oportuno et erit vnctio regum anglorum henry first duke lancaster vnder edward third warres france deliuered holy man say found reuelation enough much archbishop becket recalled exile restored former honour reuenewes carried himselfe obstinately perturbing whole state curse excommunication maintaining ecclesiasticall liberty pretended kinde dealing grieued king cursed time euer made archbishop thus explained old rime king sore displeased sayd iohn men ment myne honeste thus diseased clerk thus greeued vneased happened amongst foure knight present speech king namely reynald fitz vrse hugh moruill william tracy richard briton gathered thereby deed acceptable vnto math west killed archbishop whereupon without either warrant priuitie soueraigne posted england came sword drawne owne church therein barbarously murdered many blowes vpon tuesday december ann dom saith mat paris et counte de ce e qi morust e la feste de la trinite qestoit le vni iour de iuyn lan de grace mil troiscens septante sisine lalme de qi dieu eit mercy amen tu qi passez oue bouche close par la ou ce corp repose entent ce qe te diray sycome te dire le say come tu e au tiel fu tu seras tiel come ie su de la mort ne pensai ie mie tant come iauoy la vie en tre auoi grand richesse sont icy si grand noblesse terre meson et grand tresor draps chiuaux argent et me ore su ieo poures et chetifs perfond en la tre gi grand beaute est tout alee char est tout gastee noult est estroit meson en moy na sy verite non et si ore veisses ie ne quide pa qe vous deisses qe ie eusse onges home este sy su ie ore tant changee pur dieu priez au celestien poy qe mercy ait de barme de moy tour ceulx qi pur moy england younger sonne william rufus said william thus requited bishop king thought somewhat busie reprehending manifold vice exhorting godlinesse vertue bitterly fell banished realme poore old bishop trauelled rome wandred vp downe many country till intercession friend hee suffered returne home soone died ague harpsfeld vndec secul ca according owne desire solebat enim deum rogare vt velex author contemporarie archbishop writes followeth passage time also much grace commendation worthy metropolitan io gower cronic ripart ms bib cotheu mea penna madet lachrimis dum scribere suadet infortunata sceleris quibus horreo fata non satis est regem mundi deflectere legem vt pereant gens sub eo sine lege manentes sed magi christum seuit qua propter ad istum casum deslendum non est mihi crede tacendum anglorum prima sub primo culmine prima qui tennit sedes melius dum sperat edes hunc rex compellit eum de sede repellit dum simon rome supplantat federa thome hic thomas natus comitis fuit intitulatus clericus aptatus doctor de iure creatus legibus ornatus facundus moringeratus cam christo gratus plebe que magnisicatus quam preclarus tam purus immaculatus ad regale latus tandem fuit illaqueatus tramite subtili latitans plus vulpe senili rex studet sine thomam prostrare ruine de tribus audistis cum rex scelus intulit istis presul adiutor fuit hijs quodammodo tutor non contra legem sed ab ira flectere regem nomine pastoris temptauerat omnibus horis semper erat talis restat dum spes aliqualis sicanira mortem poterat saluasse cohortem rex lit hoc triste quod cancellarius iste tempore quo stabat ho tres constanter amabat sic procurator pius extitit mediator cartas quod regis habuerunt munere legis pontificis summi pro regis amore sic pacem mittit mortis gladiumque remittit hec ita fecisset pactum si rex tenuisset sed que iurauit hodie cras verba negauit cernite pro quali culpa magi speciali ponti ici talus sine causa materiali rex fuit iratus sed altera causa reatus est plus secreta tunc rome quando moneta simonis ex parte papam concludit ecce per causa sub regis pectore clausas hec scelus obiecit thome qui nil male secit regis fautores super hoc tunc anteriores fraudibus obtentum concludunt parliamentum sic de finali rex pondere iudiciali exilio demit thomam nee amore redemit sic pater absque pare quem rex spoliauit auare partes ignotas tunc querit habere remotas sic pius antistes casus pro tempore tristes sustinet curam sperat reuocare futuram christus eum ducat saluet que salute reducat si vt vterque status sit ei cum laude beatus vpon restauration bishopricke henry fourth duke lancaster author thus writes iustos laudauit paragraph iniustos vituperauit ho confirmauit ho deprimit ho releuauis regni primatem crudelem per feritatem quem rex explantat dux ex pietate replantat henry chichley paragraph bishop see lie north side presbitery tombe built himselfe life time hee borne higham errys northamptonshire began foundation goodly colledge hospitall finished two brother executours hee brought vp new colledge oxford proceeded doctor law founded two colledges one called bernard colledge renewed sir thomas white named saint iohns colledge soules colledge yet continueth estate left one fairest vniuersitie hee employed much embassages king henry fourth preferred bishopricke saint dauids paragraph sate fiue yeares translated hither sonne king henry fifth man happie enioying alwayes prince fauour wealth honour kinde prosperity many yeares wise gouerning see worthily bountifull bestowing good behoofe commonwealth lastly stout seuere due administration iustice hee gouerned sec yeares longer time euer fiue hundred yeares died april ann vpon whose monument finde epitaph hic iacet hen chicheley l doctor quondam cancellarius sarum ui anno hen regis ad gregorium papam ambassiata transmissus ciuitate senensi per manus eiusdem pape episcopum meneuens consecratus est hic etiam henricus anno hen regis hac sanctum ecclesia archiepiscopum postulatus ioanne papa ad eandem translatus qui obij anno dom men apr de cetus sanctor iste precetur vt deus ipsorum mer b propictetur remainei finde another vnlearned epitaph little honoured especiall furtherer learning pauper eram natus post prima hic euatus sum prostratus vermi paraius ecce meum tumulum mccccxliii iohn stafford archbishophere lie interred martyrdome archbishop noble lesse learned one honourable familie staffords sonne saith catalogue bishop vnto earle stafford finde thing catalogue honour man much fauoured king henry fifth wo preferred first deanrie well gaue prebend church salisbury made one priuie councell end treasurer england although renowned king taken away vntimely death yet hee still went forward way promotion obtained bishopricke bath welles great wisedome hee gouerned eighteene yeares whence remoued canterbury sate almost nine yeares meane time made lord chancellour england office hee held eighteene yeares shall hardly finde man haue done vntill waxing wearie painfull place voluntarily resigned ouer king hand three yeares died maidstone iuly ann vpon flat marble stone ouer finde consabulatorie epitaph quis fuit enuclees quem celas saxe mole stafford antistes fuerat dictusque iohannes qua sedit sede marmor queso simul ede pridem bathonie regni totius inde prima egregius pro presule funde precatus aureolam gratus huic det de virgine natus much may read bishop booke called antiquitates britannicae penned mathew parker archbishop place catalogue bishop francis godwin bishop hereford also catalogue lord chancellours treasurer england collected francis thinne decent monument south side presbitery iohn kempe archbishop see iohn kempe archbishop lieth interred borne wye county kent brought vp oxford merton colledge hee proceeded doctor law hee made first archdeacon durham deane arch vicar generall vnto archbishop stafford long aduanced bishopricke rochester remoued thence chichester chichester london london yorke yorke canterbury first cardinall title saint balbine remoued title saint rusine ecclesiasticall preferment comprehended one verse composed cosin thomas kempe bishop london bi prima ter praesul history archbishop yorke written rythmicall number finde commendation tunc iohannes nobilis kemp vociferatus paragraph prius londonijs presul installatus et erectus pontifex metropolitanus presul archipresulem confirmat romanus mandans sibi pallium martinus erectus sagax cancellarius regis est effectus cardinalis presbiter digne sublimatur sub balbine titulo sic laus cumulatur suthwell manerium fecit preciosum multis artificibus valde sumptuosum annis multis prospere curam sui gregis rexit per iusticiam per normam legis tandem vsque cantiam presul est translatus illic archiepiscopus est inthronizatus apud lambeth obijt labor iam finitur et cantuaria corpus sepelitur licet prohibuerit abbas rigorose iacet ibi condita gleba gloriose finde little great worke deede charitie bishop performed besides manor suthwell onely mentioned pennisome preferment reason giuen catalogue bishop died rich life time aduanced many kindred great wealth dignitie knighthood whose posteritie continued yet county great worship reputation euen day might die rich doe denie aduancement kindred honour knighthood title grandfather sir iohn kempe vncle sir roger enioyed owne father thomas yeares began foundation monasterie haue charter red booke canterbury nomine domini nostri iesu christi omnem hominem qui secundum deum viuit remunerari deo sperat optat oportet vt puris precibus consensum hilariter ex animo prebeat quoniam certum est tanto facilius ea que ipse domino poposcerit consequi posse quanto ipse libentius deo aliquid concesserit quocirca ego ethelbertus rex cantie cum consensu venerabilis archiepiscopi augustini ac principum meorum concedo honorem sancti petri aliquam partem terre inris mei que iacet oriente ciuitatis dorobernie ita duntaxat vt monasterium ibi construatur e quam supra memoraui potestate abbatis sit qui ibi sucris ordinatus adinro precipio nomine domini dei omnipotentis qui est omnium rex iudex iustus vt presata terra subscripta donatione sempiternaliter sit confirmata ita vt nec mihi nec alicui successorum meorum regum ant principum siue cuiuslibet conditionis dignitatibus ecclesiasticis gradibus de ea aliquid fraudare liceat si quis vero de hac donatione aliquid imminuere ant irritum facere tentauerit sit presenti seperatus sanctum communione corporis sanguinis christi paragraph die iuditij ob meritum malitie sue consortio sanctorum omnium segregatus dorobernie anno ab incarnatione christi sexcentesimo q indictione octaua ego ethelbertus rex cantie sana mente integroque consilio donationem mea signo sancte crucis regis edgar nomine trino diuino regi reg anti perpetuum domino deo sabaoth cui patent cuncta penetralia cordis ei corporis c ego eadgarus rex anglorum et concedo sancto augusti anglorum apostolo et fra illo sancto cenobio conuersantibus plumpsted kent terram quatuor aratrorum que nominatur plumstede hanc ergo terram um consensu archiepiscopi dunstant optimatumque meorum libenti animo concedo pro redemptione anime mee vt cam teneant perhenniterque habeant si quis vero heredum successorumqu meorum hanc meam donationem seruare vel amplificare staduerit seruetur ei benedictio sempiterna si autem sit quod non optamus quod alicuius persone homo diabolica temeritate insligatus surreperit qui vel hanc meam donationem infringere aliquo temptauerit scia se ante tribunal summi et eterni iudicis rationem esseredditurum isi ante digna et placabili satisfacti one deo et sancto augustino fratribusque emendare voluerit ego edgarus anglorum monarchus hoc donum roboraui ego dunstanus archiepiscopus consensi c land taken away earle godwin giuen sonne tostic restored backe againe abbey conquerour whose letter patent ranne forme nomine sancte et indiuidue trinitatis patris et silij et spiritus sancti ego wilhelmus dei gracia rex anglorum carta illelmi c estoris statum eccl siarum regne mei corroborans et vacillata hactenus melius confirmans atque iniuste ablata restituens concedo et annuo sancto augustino et fratribus suo cenobio commorantibus terram que dicitur plumstede hanc terram pr memorato sancto augustino et fratribus locus antiquitus possessam godwynus come fraude et vi iniuste abstulerat et suo filio tostit dederat quam tamen rex edwardus postea sancto reddiderat sit varijs euentibus possessa ablata restituta neiam vlterius calumpnie pateat aut cuiusquam querimonia cenobio sancti augustini supradictam villam auferat inde cyrographum hoc confirmo vt cam habeant tencant possideant monachi sancti augustini perpetuum si quis antem huic nostre authoritati contrarius boc violare presumpserit eterna maledictionis dampnatione se mulctandum nouerit et regie vindicte subi cebit ego wilhelmus gratia dei rex angloram hanc cartam confirmo et mei firmandam committo ego le kent odo archiepiscopus baiocensis calumpniam quam ipsa terra habebam relinquo et lubens subscribo ego wilhelmus londonens episcopus subscribo c abbey endowed ample reuenues many others valued deo grata fuit ac homini peramata edbald king kenthere sometime lay body edbald entombed king kent sonne heire named ethelbert queene berta began raigne wickedly father ended worthily hee refused entertaine doctrine christ beda li cap polluted himselfe marriage mother law owne father second wife length conuerted archbishop lawrence idolatrie incestuous matrimonie hee endeuoured meanes possible propagate maintaine state gospell king kent edbald furst wyf forsoke r b glocest held hym hys christendom yat furst toke built chappell within monasterie honour mary blessed mother god endowing odde monethes finished dayes ann egbert king kent egbert succeeded father ercombert murther two cosingermans much blemished peaceable gouernment might well haue holden place worthiest kentish king exceeding tall stature well fauoured amiable countenance learning finde little worthy remembrance sine doctrina sana docebat saith one ac sine perceptibili lingua ignotae praedicabat genti bal centur lawrence archebysschop prymate wo god full sore prayde porposynge eke leve hys estate follow iuste mellet wer strayde owt lond wer afrayde nyght lawrence slepe sent peter hym bett iyll wepe hys hyde blod full fast gan renne sayeng hym wh wyll thow forsake floke toke dyd nne among wo e ravyshe take thou hast forgett god sake sufferd yng pryson dethe end hys serv nd commend wherfor morrow came ethelbalde shewyd hym sore bett wyse wyght hym tolde wherfor yt wythouten longer lett whyche kynge full sorow sett hast dyd send iust eke melite restoryd ther wher yte teche feythe voyd idolatry baptyse eke expedye whyche necessary archebysschop dyed hight lawrence yere crist wyth good benyvolence syx hundryd hole ther withall nyntene levyng world heuens blyse wene laurence writ learned booke thus much old manuscript fame language deliuered ann obijt iohannes mansel partibus transmarinis mansels death ex epit r geri houeden bib co paupertate et dolore maximo hic miser tot obtentus ecclesiasticos habuit vt annuatim ex illis xviii millia marcarum poterat expendere vnde maiores episco anglie recusauit tum quia pluralitate permultarum preditissimarum ecclesiaru habundauit tum quia lubricus erat hic ait de vna ecclesia modici census benefice dogges mea scilicet librarum ad cane nostros valet ista ecclesia innuens per hoc quod surfures et farina et alia canibus necessaria ex prouentu istius ecclesie deberent comparari hic autem cum esset earle lei cester mansel cause warres betweene hen third baron simonis aduersarius scilicet mounteforti et consiliarius precipuus suaset regi vt iuramentum quod fecerat cum baronibus pro fidelitate anglie seruanda omnino dimitteret factumque est ita mittitur igitur ad curiam summi pontificis pro absolutione petenda ne rex teneretur prestito baronibus iuramento obtinuitque mox regia supplicatio absolutionem petitam vnde bellum de quo dictum est accepit post illius absolutionis obtentum c man many time double beneficed paris n mathew paris doth thus descant admirabantur autem cum stupore qui ea quae dei sunt sapiunt hominem tam circumspectum charge soules tot animarum curam suscepisse non formidare cum de omnibus coram summo iudice vt reddat rationem sihi se constiterit obligatum sed vt verificetur multi multa sciunt seipsos penitus nescientes haue seene pedigree mansels philip de mansel came conquerour vntill time whiche found harding c whyles liuing reigned much trouble wo realme without ryght fro themprise maude faire lady bryght cause driuen perforce defend vsur ped authoritie sword must need procure hatred solamen nunc tecum quesumus amen archbishop bestowed much building enlarging house especially vpon castle saltwood towards reparation church canterbury gaue mark hee gaue also vnto church certaine many miracle said haue beene wrought lanfranke archbishop lanfranke haue written recorded capgraue amongst english saint saith vpon first entrance metropoliticall gouernment found monkes canterbury sicut omnes fere tum temporis anglia secularibus simile rest almost time england like secular person venari aucupari et potibus indulgere consueuerunt accustomed hunt hawke giue minde excessiue drinking short time gentle perswasions reclaymed man affable pleasant humble skilfull many science prudent counsell gouernment thing religion life holy meruit ergo inter sanctos annumerari therefore deserues numbred amongst saint anselm archbishop anselm integritie life depth learning euen admirable regard whereof many miracle said wrought liuing reliques dead hee canonized saint foure hundred yeares decease great charge iohn moorton one successours archbishopricke learned braine brought forth world many profound work least fiftie seuerall bookes treatise many still extant miracle likewise attributed holinesse many mentioned capgraue next come catalogue farre famed saint thomas becket thomas commonly called thomas canterbury haue already spoken enough another place thus much time polyolbion followeth saint thomas becket rome much honourd hery christned name added canterbury whose sumptuous shrine neere succeeding age mighty offering sent made pilgrimage concerning world since hath spent much breath many question made life death truly iust hath right time much blame haue reckond edmund man famous vertue great learning borne abingdon barkeshires edmund archbishop sonne one edward rich merchant mother name mabell elder yeares forsooke mutuall consent betooke themselues monasticall life edmund sonne caused bee brought vp vniuersity colledge oxford hauing attained reasonable perfection knowledge diuinitie whereunto study chiefly addicted hee applyed himselfe preaching wherein tooke great paine namely county oxford glocester worcester vntill time hee called treasureship salisbury whence little knowing matter much minde chosen pope request monkes christchurch rome archbishop see consecrated canterbury honour possible roger bishop london fourth none aprill yeare king henry third thirteene bishop one fourty lord earles others innumerable present thus recorded annalls monastery wauerley surrey edmundus thesaurarius sarum miss bib cott domino rogero episcopo london consistentibus et congratulantibus xiii episcopis domingo rege et xli comitibus et ceteris numeris communiter congregatis ecclesia cant archiepiscopum honorifice consecratur dominica qua canitur letare iher salem iiii viz nonas aprilis howsoeuer thus solemnly consecrated presently fell king displeasure opposing himselfe marriage elianor king sister simon mountfort earle leicester vpon death earle marshall first husband vowed chastity haue vow dispensed withall king procured pope send legate england name otto cardinall also archbishop offended grieuously reprehending monstrous couetousnesse bribery extortion euer sought worke mischiefe might monkes rochester presented vnto archbishop one richard de wendouer demanding consecration vnto bishopricke church vtterly denyed affoord knowing presented bee vnlearned vnsufficient man hereupon monkes appealed rome archbishop vnderstanding hasted thither also otto legate endeauoured stay home failing thereof errand well rome onely suite another also hee hugh earle arundell another cause appeale ouerthrowne condemned thousand markes charge great disgrace impouerishment rome hee complained many great abuse england amongst rest long vacancie bishoprickes pope seemed willing redresse thing namely concerning matter set downe order pope absolute power cathedrall church continued voide aboue sixe moneths lawfull archbishop conferre list paragraph well smaller benefice procuring order cost great summe money yet sooner backe turned pope king request reuoked thus continually vexed thwarted disgraced hee departed voluntary exile bewayling misery countreyh ty nny spoyled wasted tyranny pope spent rest dayes continuall teares extreame griefe sorrow thinke much fasting hee fell first consumption strange kinde ague whereupon thought good remoue abbey pontiniac france layen euer since comming england departed life sixteenth kalends december heart entrailes buried soissy body pontiniac paragraph sanctus edmundus cantuarie archiepiscopus plenus virtutibus et san titate migrauit ab hoc seculo xvi kal decemb et apud pontiniacum sepultus est cuius merita miracula testantur hic erat edmundus anima tum corpore mundus quem non immundus poterat peruertere mundus anglorum genti faueas edmunde petenti within six yeares death canonized saint innocentius fourth appointed foresaid day death euer kept holy memory lewes french king caused body translated honourable tombe first laid bestowed sumptuous shrine vpon couered gold siluer richly adorned many pretious stone lord saith legend hath shewyd many fayre came succour germany battell slaine generalls side catigern britaine horsa saxon one buried horsted horsted farre hence gaue name place catigern honoured stately solemne funerall thought haue beene interred neare vnto ailisford vnder side hill catigern sepulchre saw foure huge rude hard stone erected two side one transuersall middest betweene hugest piled layed ouer manner british monument called stonehenge artificially mortis tenents verily vnskilfull common people call day catigern keiths kit coty house like monument horsa horsted stormes time haue deuoured battell smitten yeare grace iclesham little rent william de marci ela wife sciant c quod ego radulphus de iclesham dedi et confirmaui deo ecclesie sancti laurencij de oteham terram oteham c pro anima radulphi de dene aui mei qui predictam ecclesiam fundauit c sciant presentes c quod no willelmus de marci et ela vxar mea dedimus et concessimus deo et sancto laurentio de oteham archi turris london et canonicis ibidem deo episcopus seruus seruorum dei dilectis filijs maiori et eius locum tenenti pope bul staple merchant portable alt r massepriest ac constabulario ceterisque principalibus societatis mercatorum lanarum stapule anglie salutem et apostolicam benedictionem sincere deuotionis affectus quem ad no et romanam geritis ecclesiam non indigne meretur vt petitionibus vestris illis presertim quos ex deuotionis feruore prodire conspicimus quantum cum deo possumus fauorabiliter animamus hinc est quod no vestris deuotis supplicationibus inclinati vt liceat vobis et posteris vestris maiori et eius locum tenenti ac constabulario nec non principalibus societatis mercatorum lanarum stapule anglie ac vestrum ac eorundem posterorum cuilibet habere altare portatile cum debita reuerentia et honore super quo villa calestie seu alibi etiam transmarinis seu cismarinis partibus vbi pro tempore vos vel aliquem vestrum esse vel declinare et huiusmodi stapulum lanarum teneri contigerit locis ad hoc congru ntibus et honestis positis per proprium vel alium sacerdotem ydoneum missas et alia diuina officia sine iuris alieni preiudicio vestra et ipsorum ac aliorum mercatorum dicte societatis ibidem pro tempore presentium nec non vestrorum et eorundem posterorum ac mercatorum familiarium presentia facere celebrari vobis et predictis posteris tenore presentium indulgemus nulli ergo omnino homini liceat hanc paginam nostre concessionis infringere vel ei ausu temerario contraire si quis autem hoc attemptare presumpserit indignationem omnipotentis dei et beatorum petri et pauli apostolorum eius se nouerit incursurum dat mant non nouemb pontificatus nostri ann primo another bull dated yeare apostolicall authoritie giues free election confessour priesttheir priest confessour word aliquem ydoneum et discretum presbyterum eligere confessorem indulgemus qui quotiens vobis fuerit oportunum confessionibus vestris diligenter auditis pro commissis debitam vobis absolutionem impendat et iniungat penitentiam salutarem nisi forsan talia fuerint c propter que sedes apostolica c nulli ergo omnino hominum c dat c english fauourably yeeld deuout pious supplication giue leaue choose sufficient discreete priest confessor often shall thought conuenient confession attentiuely heard may giue due absolution delinquency committed appoint sauing comfortable penance vnlesse offence nature apostolicall chaire sought remission therefore let lawfull man wise infringe kind foolehardinesse rashly contradict cartulary concession indeed one presume attempt let know certaine shall incurre indignation almighty god blessed apostle peter paul giuen c followes forme absolution made apostolicall consistory plenary indulgence pronounced priest one merchant whensoeuer shall bee dangerously sicke word ego authoritate dei omnipotentis beatorum petri et pauli apostolorum eius forme absolution et domini nostri martini pape quinti mihi hac parte specialiter commissa secundum quod potestas mihi tradita se extendit et quantum debeo et possum si ista vice moriaris te absolvo ab omnibus penis purgatorii que tibi purgatorio debentur propter culpas et offensas quas contra deum commisisti et te restituo illi innocentie qua era tempore quo baptizatus fuisti nomine patris et filii et spiritus sancti amen authority almighty god blessed apostle peter paul lord master martin fift pope resort famous countrey thus gloriously report noble kent drayton polyol song quoth praise doth thee belong hardst controld impatientest wrong norman first pride horrour swayd threwst seruile yoke vpon formost euer plact shall reckoned bee let towne chiefe thy rich countrey british see still metropolis throwing norman yoke learned illustrator selden thus speakes explaine saith thus english fragment flowre laudable brute euery cytye towne serche world rowne neuer yet caste downe many haue rome carthage hierusalem sage many age storye ye may see thys oldely founded surely grounded man may confounde yt sure stone yt vpon sette though haue yt thrette manasses grym great yet hurte yt none cryste stone cytye sette vpon whyche hys foon hath euer preserued yt meane dyvyne seruyce contynuall wyse kept deuout guyse uuythin mure yt house relygyon diuerse place thys towne whyche great deuocyon ben euer occupyed one hath done another begyn prayer neuer blyn order house wythin wyth vertue allyed paryshe chyrches reken whyche nomber shall speken wherein speke many preste deken eryste dayly serue meane whyche sacryfyce truste wyse thys cytye servyce doth euer preserue cytye meane y troynouaunt honour worschipp doth haunt uuyth vertue ryches accordaunt cytye yt lyke speke euery commodity fleshe fishe dentye cloth sylke wyth wyne plenty y hole syke brede ale wyth spyces fyne wyth house fayre soupe dyne nothyng lackynke condygne man y molde uuyth riuers freshe holsome ayer wyth woman good fayre thys cytye done repayre straungers many folde vytayle herein spente thre housholdes dayly tente betwene rome ryche kent none may theym compare mayre shriues twayne myght iustyce sayne kept wythyn cytye playne long declare though shuld day tell wyth ryme dogerell myght yet halfe spell townes great honour therfore shortly began pray yt chyld man yt may continue bere floure reader rymes hym lyketh versys rede wyth fauour pray theym spell let rudenes theym hym lede despraue thys ryme cantuar archiepiscopus dira predixisse verbis quoniam aspirasti ad regnum per mortem fratris tui cuius sanguine conspirauerunt angli cum ignominiosa matre tua non deficiet gladius de domo tua seuiens te omnibus diebus vite tue interficiens de semine tuo quousque regnum tuam transferatur regnum alienum cuius ritum et linguam gen cui presides non nouit nec expiabitur nisi longa vindicta peccatum tuum et peccatum matris tue peccata virorum qui interfuere concilio illius nequam que sicut viro sancto predicta erant euenerunt nam etheldredus varijs prelijs per swanum danorum regem filium que suum canutum fatigatus fugatus ac tandem londini arcta obsidione conclusus misere diem obijt anno dominice incarnationis postquam annis magna tribulatione regnasset etheldred neither forward action malms first auspicious entrance ancient citie ann die aprilis thus king ouercome come welcome bee receiued subiects place shout acclamation ioy demonstration truest loyaltie loue obedience conducted guarded admirable confluence nobilitie gentrie common vnto throne lawfull inheritance erkenwald bishop lond hoc loco requiescit domino erconwaldus tertius post anglosaxonum britannia ingressam episcopus londinensis cuius episcopatu ante episcopatum vita fuit sanctissima ex nobili prosapia oriundus offe orientalium saxonum regis erat filius ad fidem christianam mellito primo londini episcopo dom conuersus priusquam episcopus factus esset duo preclara construxit monasteria sumptibus suis de bonis que ture hereditario sibi obuenerunt vnum sibi finibus australium saxonum loco qui certesey vocatur alterum edelburge sorori sue femine laudatissime ad berching ditione orientalium saxonum episcopatum vero anno salutis theodoro robernensium siue cantuarie archiepiscopo sacratus est sebbam orientalium saxonum regem ad christi sidem conuertit et salutari baptismatis vnda suis manibus per fudit qui statim mundo renuncians se totum deo addixit hac ipsa ecclesia archa marmorea que ad nostra vsque tempora permanet sepultus est idem erconwaldus celeberrimum hoc pauli templum nouis edificijs auxit prouentibus locupletauit et eidem immunitates nonnullas regibus impetrauit tandem circiter annum domini spiritum deo reddidit postquam annis vndecim pontificatu sedisset et magnifico sepulchro hic conditus est quod nostra memoria circiter annum domini hoc loco visebatur carefull holy bishop erconwald onely bestowed great paine charge vpon beautifying enlarging church faire new building de gestis pontif lib enricht ample reuenues many immunity obtained diuers king prince also procured pope agatho first sundry important priuiledges good canon habetur ergo erkenwaldus saith malmesbury londonie maxime sanctus pro exauditionis celeritate fauorem canonicorum nonnihil emeritus beda lib prostratus iacet anno pontificatus ter vix domini mil sexagint bi que bi c huic si saluamen deus te deprecor amen hic requiescit domino rogerus cognomento niger quondam canonicus huius ecclesie pauli rager black bishop london ac deinde londinens episcopum consecratus anno salutis vir literatura profundus moribus honestus ac per omnia laudabilis christiane religionis amator ac defensor strenuus qui cum pastorale officium vigilanter studiose rexisset annis diem suum clausit extremum apud manerium suum de stebunheath calend octob ann christi regnante rege hen contigit diebus dum episcopus iste rogerus hac ecclesia ante maius altare staret infulatus ad celebrandum diuina quod tanta aere facta est nubium densitas vt vix alterum discernere possit quam confestim sequnta est tonitrui horribilis concussio cum tanta fulminis coruscatione ac fetore intollerabili vt omnes qui aderant rapide fugientes nihil verius quam mortem expectarent solus episcopus cum vno diacono remansit intrepidus aere tandem purgato episcopus residuum rei diuine expleuit may reade mathew paris stoutly hee withstood pope nuntio comming england proling deuise scrape vp money master good bishop cried vpon vnreasonable shamelesse couetousnesse court rome hee onely meanes staying course grieuous exaction may also reade fearfull story cymerian darknesse horrible thunderclap happened vpon day paul conuersion cathedrall church bishop masse many miracle saith author wrought tombe let v heare epitaph ecclesie quondam presul presentis anno bi c quater x iacet hic rogerus humatus huius erat manibus domino locus iste dicatus christe suis precibus veniam de tolle reatus bishop roger excommunicated caursini dangerous stout attempt dayes called pope merchant indeed execrable romane vsurers entangled king himselfe nobilitie others court rome cunning snare called caursini saith paris quasi capientes vrsi deuouring beares orate pro anima roberti brabroke quondam episcopi huius ecclesie cuius corpus hic tumulatur rob braybrooke bishop london qui obijt augusti cum sedisset ann bishop aduanced honour lord chancellour vpon saint mathewes eue sixth yeare king richard second office enioyed longer march following vpon disagreement betwixt iohn gaunt duke lancaster may reade large tho walsingham hist angl rob fitzhugh bishop londonhere lieth interred body robert fitzhugh bishop london doctor law sometimes archdeacon northampton beene twice embassadour germany another time rome hee elected bishop ely died intended translation could perfected septemb ann effect thus speakes epitaph nobilis antistes robertus londoniensis filius hugonis requiescit honor doctorum flos pontificij quem contulit ely rome basilie regia facta refert plangite eum rex grex tria natio tota extera gen si qua nouerat vlla pium gemma pudicitie spectrum bonitatis honoris famaque iusticie formula iuris erat mors violenta rapit viuentem vnde cui mors extitit et moritur vita beata tulit mille quadragentis triginta quinque sub annis festo mauri celica regna petit thomas kempe bishop london infra capellam istam requiescit corpus domini thome kemp quondam episcopi london fundatoris eiusdem et vnius cantarie perpetue eadem qui multa bona tempore vite sue ecclesie sancti pauli et stetit annis diebus episcopus london ac obijt die men martij ann dom cuius anime propitietur deus amen thomas kempe nephew iohn kempe archbishop canterbury whose hand hee receiued consecration yorke place called white hall ann febr vnkle archbishop yorke bishop duke vmphrey commonly beleeued report built brian twyn antiq acad ox part diuinitie schooles oxford stood bodleyes foundation wall arch vault doores tower pinnacle square smooth polisht stone artificially depainted doctor chaire liuely representation glorious frame celestiall globle built also paul crosse forme standeth lieth iohn stokesley bishop church iohn stokesley bishop london brought vp magdelene colledge oxford enthronized iuly died septemb part epitaph yet remaines inlaid brasse approues haue beene good linguist great schollar huius obscuro tumuli interiore recessit stokesley cineres ossaque tecta iacent cuius fama patens vite decus ingenijque dexteritas luce tamen iste deo regique suo populoque fideli viueret vt charus perpetuo studuit exterius siquidem potuit regionibus qui latias lustrauit opes intrauit hebreas huic grecorum palma parata londe wretchede aftur maximian folk wey gan lede alle knyghtes swayn much yong hede othur londes storede therwyth ala deolfull dede ye beth men bet ytaught shouele spade cart eke plough fishyng wade hamer nedle othur craftes also sper swerd battaile whan enemyes cometh ne kunneth fle shep uuolues hough myght woo see biset yow al abowte hough mowe ye thenche othur ligge slawe othur fle drenche help ther nan yow clenlich alle londe al helpyng lokyng othur man honde romaynes beth anoyed hure traualle sore perile see londe ek hii wole come hii wolleth hure truage rather leue ye berith yere konne ye nought lerny thyng ye dede neuer ere applieth yowr hondes sper swerd also strongur men buth ther none ye wolde turne therto seeth bond mannes sone somtym knyght bycome grom squyer aftur de praesulibus angl deane yorke treasurer towne cali made archbishop canterbury honour enioyed past two yeares remoued forced leade priuate life long time last lift vp honour bishopricke london left present life within compasse yeere following man thus writeth thomas walsingham liued time much effect vse owne language vpodigma neustricae anno dominus rogerus de waldene debitum naturae soluit qui varia fortuna vectus expertus est sub breui tempore quam sit inconstans incerta volubilis ipsa errans instabilis vaga quae dum stare putatur occidit et falso mutatur gaudia vultu nempe ex pauperculo factus est regni thesaurarius proceeds forward story vpon monument epitaph inlayd brasse hic iacet rogerus de walden episcopus londinens qui cum vtraque fortuna plurimu laborauit ex hac vita migrauit die nouem dom vir cultor verus domini iacet intra rogerus walden fortuna cu nunquam steterat vna nunc requiem tumuli deus omnipotens dedit illi gaudet et celis plaudet vbi quisque fidelis denied prefatus tamen rogerus dominicum beneficium sine regis assensu et licentia acceptare noluit nec vult ni presenti rex concedit eidem rogero licentiam quod ipse tanquam verus pastor et episcopus dicte iudicare deprecor maiestatem tuam vt tu deleas iniquitatem meam ecce quid eris langham master temple hic iacet willelmus langham quondam custos huius templi qui obijt tu prope qui transis nec dicis aueto resiste auribus et corde hec mea dictum tene sum quod eris quod e ipse fui derisor amare mortis dum licuit pace manente frui sed veniente nece postquam sum raptus amicis atque mei famulis orba domus contexit humo deplorauit que iacentem inque meos cineres vltima dona dedit vnde mei vultus corrosit terra nitorem queque fuit forme ergo deum pro cum pura mente precare vt mihi perpetua pace
