impetrari curabo neque ab aliis impetratum vllo modo curabo c hec omnia et singula recipio hec iureiurando promitto fideliter obseruaturum sicut deus adiuuet et hec sacrosancta eius euangelia que omnia singula n abbati westmonast visitatori predicti hospitalis spondeo c incentum libris sterlingorum ad vsum hospitalis predicti meipsum firmiter obligo c regule quedam obseruande sit magister continue residens hospitali predicto nullumque officium administrationem quarumcunque rerum aut cuiuscunque rei vel sub aliqua persona spirituali aut temporali cuiuscunque dignitatis aut conditionis fuerit acceptabit aut geret neque eiusdem seruitor capellanus officiariusve nec absit hospitalis negotiis vltra quadraginta aliquo anno pro singulis diebus necessarie sue absentie hospitalis causis habeat pro se duobus sibi servitoribus tantum tres solidos magister hospitalis pro tempore existens habeat sibi vltra vnam togam siue liberatam suam pro expensis oris sui siue victus proque vadijs suis quibuscunque alijs necessarijs habeat triginta libra annuatim soluendas per manus suas proprias ad quatuor anni terminos vsuales per equales portiones nec magister nec alij portabunt vestes chappell religious structure first begun king stephen foundation stephen chappell afterwards finished reuenewes greatly augmented king edward third placed deane twelue canon secular many vicar minister lodging canon row habitation diuers nobleman gentleman word king edward grant dei nomine amen charta regis ed tetijs ex record turr london edwardus dei gratia c salutem capellam quandam omnipotentis dei et specialiter beatissime genetricis eius marie et dicti martyris ordinamus volumus constituimus et aucthoritate nostra regia perpeiou stabilimus quod sint exeuntes decanus vnus et rex christicola ver x fuit hac regione qui nunc celicola gaudet mercede corone rex humilis docilis scius pius inclytus iste sollicite nitide tacite placide bone christe vult servire tibi perficiendo sibi ornat more spernit flores lucis auare gliscens multum christi cultum letificare ecclesiam nimiam nimio studio fabricauit hec illesa manus que fundamenta locauit hic septingentis annisterra cumulatus christi clementis instinctibus inde leuatus isto sub lapide nunc iacet ipse vide atque domum christo quia mundo fecit isto nunc pro mercede celi requiescit ede respice mortalis promissio sit tibi talis accipies si de nil capies nisi de e christo qualis christus erit tibi talis dapsilis esto sibi largus eritque tibi effectus non affectus si reddere possis debet censeri si nihil reddere possis tunc bonus affectus pro facto debet haberi sicut de lignis per aquam depellitur ignis sic malo commissa fiunt donando remissa reddet ad vsuram quod quis dat nomine christi nam vitam puram pro weekes dayes raigne time buriall seynt edward hadde thus told ganne clos hys eyghe iiii dey ianuar gan deye yer owr lord mlxvi ryght aftur owr swete lord hys moder alyght kyng xxiiii yer ii monyethes therto three wekes vi deyes r lyf ido al franchyse engelond al ioy blis wyth hym faste beryd thulke tym wi men fonde sone aftyrward wyth meny delful ca atte westmynster twelfth dey godeman beryed rob glocest simplenesse saith author callyd edward simple yet sothe lord noryshede hys symplenes yaf hym grete grase men shold adradde hym courhe natte wrothe though men trowed hym slow sim le hadde subiects vndyr hym atte he dauntyd enemyes syward erle northumbyrlonde leofricus erle hereforde defendyd kyng euer mor wyth ther manhode fauor ayenst mantenors duc godwy e questionle sanctitie life coronyd anoyntyd ryghte heyre engelond withe moche honor worsschyp aftur masse kyng went hys paleys holde ryall feste amonges hym doon seruyse worsschyp whanne set hys mete kyng alexandre scotland come doo hym seruyse worsschyp wyth queyntyse hondryd knyghtes hym horsed arayd whanne lyght theyr horse let theyr horse goon whether wolde wolde take hadde owne behofe wythoute chalange aftyr come syr edmond king edwardes broder curtayse knyght gentyll ren erle cornwayle erle glowcesire aftyr theym come erle penbroke erle warren eche ledde theyr hondes selfe hordryd knight disgyse armes whan alyght horse lete goo whedyr wolde cowde take hadde stylle theyr owne lyking whanne doon kyng edward dyd hys dyligens hys myght amende relme redresse wronges best maner honor god profyte crowne holy cherche amende anoyance comon peple worthiest knyght alle world honor worsschyp grace god hym euer hadde vyctory hys enemyes expugnauit saracenos chron compend cant ms bib cot franco scotos wallenses et perfidos christianos et quicquid regale glorie et honori tam actibus quam moribus competit ipso potuit reperiri vanquished sarasines french scot welsh perfidious christian whatsoeuer appertained regall glory honour well action condition state princely deportment found dum vi rex et valuit sua magna potestas frau latuit pax magna fuit regnauit honestas saith old latin rimer king thus translated like english lyued thys kynge hys powre thynge good plyghte fabian gyle hydde great peace kept kydde honeste myghte scotos edward dum vixit suppeditauit tenuit afflixit depressit dilaniauit thither accompanied seuenscore knight retinue whose support prouided thirty two thousand pound siluer heart conuayed hope god thing would prosper lastly vpon paine eternall damnation said money embalmed body enwrapt often renewed doth appeare vpon record thus rex thesaurario camerarijs suis salutem mandamus vobis quod ceram existentem circa corpus celebris memorie domini edwardi nuper regis anglie progenitoris nostri filij regis henrici ex arch turr lond ecclesia beati petri westm humatum de denarijs nostris renovari facietis prout hactenus fieri constituit teste rege apud westm xi die iulij claus ric memb certaine rime verse annexed tombe followeth mors est inesta nimis magnos que iungit imis maximum mors minimis coniungens vltima primis nullus orbe fuit homo viuens nec valet esse qui non morte ruit est hinc exire necesse nobilis fortis tibi tu considere noli omnia sunt mortis sibi subdit singula solo de mundi medio magnum mors impia mouit anglia pre tedio satis anxia plangere novit corruit edwardus vario veneratus honore rex nuper vt nardus fragrans virtutis odore corde leopardus invictus absque pauore ad rixam tardus discretus eucharis ore viribus armorum quasi gigas ardua gessit colla superborum prudens per prelia pressit inter flandrenses fortuna sibi bene fauit vt quoque wallenses scotos suppeditauit rex bonus absque pari strenue sua regna regebat quod natura dari potuit bonitatis habebat actio iustitie pax regni sanctio legis et fuga nequitie premunt precordia regis gloria tota ruit regem capit hec modo fossa rex quandoque fuit nunc nil nisi puluis et os filius ipse dei quem corde colebat et ore gaudia fecit ei nullo permista dolore verse saith fabian entent minde also reader might haue desire ouerreade haue therefore set baladde royall rude making followeth sorrowfull deth bryngeth great full low fabian ballad royall moost leest ioyneth one thys man whome pere knowe hath subdued nat sparyng hym alone whyche order thys world ouergone none spared great equyte yf noblesse spared shuld therfore thou noble myghty trust none oder grace thou shalt pay deth thy naturall dette lyke thys world chace thys mighty prynce frendys fette whome englond loude mourned grette shalt thou oder deths snare fall none shall escape reckyn kyndes edward wyth many dyuers grace endowed like nardus sweetest odoure smellynge passyth moost allowed swete odour dyd knyghtly floure vertuous artes surmounte honoure oder prynces whose hert lybar delyke without fere hole syke thys prynce slowe maner stryfe discrete wise trewe worde army geaunt terme lyfe excelling actes dynte sworde subduyd proud prudence bore horde flaunders fate great amyte walshe scottes strength subduyd good king perelesse landes firmly gyded nature might giue failed nothynge parte bounte discided iustice peace lawe stablishyng chaser iniquyte vertuous liuyng whome grace innumerable mo fermly roted deth hath tane v fro whylom kyng duste bone glory fallen pitte kepeth kynge yeldeth thing one sonne god aboue thynge herte mouth worsshyppyng lord ioy perdurable laste graunt sorrowlesse euermore taste king haue long hand alluding extensure regall gouernement ouid one epistle thus nescis longas regibus esse manus king also long legges longis tibijs surnamed hee longshankes stray beyond limit vertues haue taken prisoner detained much longer expected let take liberty conclude verse commendation valour foreremembred addition robert glocester edward furst reguyd truly son kyng harry conquered scotlond ano toke irlond hys hond callyd tym conqueror god yiue hys soul mych honor hys tym made subiecte alwalys put vndre yecke behedyd thilke sam tym prynce uualys lewellyn iewes tym withouten doute lond wer clere put oute atte westmynstre hy burying xxxv yere reguyd kyng queen right annexed crowne england moreouer said king edward ardent affection memory deceased eleanor gaue twelue mannors lordship hamlet walter abbot westminster successor euer keeping yeerely obit said queene money geeuen poore came solemnization epitaph nobilis hispani iacet hic soror inclita regis eximij consors eleanora thori edwardi primo wallorum principis vxor cui pater henricus tertius anglus erat hanc ille vxorem gnato petit omine princeps legati munus suscipit ipse bono alfonso fratri placuit felix hymeneus germanam edwardo nec sine dote dedit do preclara fuit nec talus indigna marito pontino princeps munere diues erat femina consilio prudens pia prole beata auxit amicitijs auxit honore virum disce mori lieth gloriously entombed edward third king england mighty monarch euer ware crowne england conquered cali recouered aquitaine normandy tooke iohn king france dauid king scot prisoner added armes title france owne declaring claime kind verse thus rex sum regnorum bina ratione duorum remaines anglorum regno sum rex ego iure paterno matris iure quidem francorum nuncupor idem hinc est armorum variatio facta meorum french answered scornefully verse temper touching edward ill grounded vanitie pretending right crown france queen isabell mother daughter succeed sacred lillie france eldest sister must march madam margaret france wife ferdinand fourth name king castille praedo regnorum qui diceris esse duorumfauine order england francorum regno priuaberis atque paterno matris vbique nullum ius broles non habet vllum iure mariti carens alia est mulier prior illa succedunt mare huic regno non mulieres hinc est armorum variatio stulta tuorum excelled ancestor also victorious valour child obedience loue among themselues one greatest felicity lady wife fruitfull mother faire issue excellent vertue gouernement king edward fortune seemed fall eclipse hidden sepulchre sonne edward second isabel daughter philip faire king france father amoued kingdomes gouernement guilty thought publike sanction thereupon established royall throne age fourteene yeeres raigned yeeres died manor shine iune verse annexed monument hic decus anglorum flos regum preteritorum forma futurorum rex clemens pax populorum tertius edwardus regni complens iubileum inuictus pardus pollen bellis machabeum tertius edwardus fama super ethera notus pugna pro patria foure verse thus translated speed history said king vpon word pollen bellis machabeum giues marginall note followeth meanes saith able battaile machabeus must beare breaking priscians head written king vsed breake waltham lord bishop salisbury beene master rolles keeper priuie seale treasurer england office continued till death happened yeare hauing sate bishop yeares executed treasurorship foure yeares king richard second loued entirely greatly bewailed death token whereof hee commanded hee buried among king vita r hoc anno saith walshingham viz yeare obijt iohannes de waltham episcopus sarum regni thesaurarius qui tantum regi complacuerit vt etiam multis licet murmurantibus apud monasterium inter reges meruit sepulturam lieth pauement vnder flat marble stone iust beside king edward first vpon epitaph inlayd brasse portraiture episcopall robe defaced almost quite perished richard wendouer bishop r ch sterhere lyeth another bishop buried conspicuous princely place church doth waltham cromwellhere lieth interred sir humfrey bourchier lord cromwell sonne henry bourchier earle essex isabell daughter richard earle cambridge sister richard duke yorke aide kinsman king edward fourth slaine barnet field vpon easter day sir humphrey bourchier lieth interred another humfrey bourchier sonne heire iohn bourchier lord berners also slaine battaile whose memory epitaph yet remaines hic pugil ecce iacens bernet fera bella cupiscens certat vt eacides fit saucius vndique mile vt cecidit vulnus mar porrigit arma cruore sparsim tincta rubent dolor en lachrimabilis hora lumine nempe cadit quo christus morte resurgit bourchier humfridus clara propagine dictus edwardi regis qui tertius est vocitatus iohn domini berners prole et paruulus here quartus et edwardus belli tenet ecce triumphum christ colledge made one executours liued likewise long time great fauour grandchild king henry eight euen vntill marriage anne bullein euer seemed disallow whereupon suspected accused councell elizabeth barton commonly called holy maide kent nunne saint sepulchre canterbury sundrie suggestiue reuelations gaue king proceeded diuorce second marriage raigne realme seuen moneths rest god fauour space houre story frequent imputation thus excused himselfe letter king maiestie king gracious highnes please graciouse highenes benignely heare humble sutethe bishop rochester letter amongst letter bib cotton haue make vnto grace time pardon come selfe vnto grace good faith haue many periculouse disease oone another began advent long continuance hath brought body weakenesse withouten perill destruction darr saye grace soueraigne goodnes wold may yet take traueyling vpon soo wrote maister cromwell moost trustie councellor cromwell principal secretary beseeching obtayne graciouse licence absent parliament cause put comforthe soo doo thus graciouse soueraygne lord high court parliament put bill concerning nunne canterbury intending condempnation reuelyng wordes hadde vnto towchyng highnes wherein moost humblie beseech grace without displeasor maye shew vnto consideration moued doo moost ex cellent wisdome hath deaplye considered trust assuredlie charitable goodnes impute blame therfore trowth nunne thries commyng london rochester wrote master cromwell shewed vnto occasion commyng sending vntyll hir againe first tyme came vnto house vnsent partye tolde hadde bene grace hadde shewed vnto reuelation hadde almighty god grace hope displeased rehearsall thereof sayd grace went forth purpose ye intended ye shold king england seuen moneths conceaued theis wordes take vpon soule malice euill intended ment vnto highnes mor man butt oonly thei threattes god affirme though thei feaned wold saued vnknowen neuer counsailled hir vnto feanyng privaye thervnto purpose sayd thei went aboute neuerthelesse hadde told reuelation hadde alsoo told hadde reported vnto grace hadde bene verylie farre blame worthy extreame punyshment disclosing vnto highenes else counsaill sithen assure therewith hadde playnelye told vnto grace thynge thought doubtlesse grace wold haue suspected commyn renewe hir tale agayne vnto yow rather confermyng myn opinion cause beseech highenes take displeasor saye stykketh yet moost graciouse soueraygne hart little heuynesse youre greeuous letter youre moost fearfull wordes grace hadde vnto shewyng vnto yow mynde opinion matter notwithstandyng highnesse hadde soo often soo straytly commanded serch cause right loth haue comyn vnto grace agayne tale pertayning matter meny consideration hadde cause came vnto grace good faith dradde lest shold therby haue prouoked grace farther displeasor agaynste lord il warbam canterbury also great counsaillor told hadde bene grace hadde shewed yow matter hym answeare god learned greatter thynges pretensed vision told herselfe tyme shewede vnto hym hadde bene told haue written trust excellent wisdome learnynge seeth y defawte reuelynge hir wordes vnto grace whan hir selfe affirme vnto hadde soo done lord canterbury confermed alsoo wherfore moost graciouse soueraygne lord humble wise besech highenes dimisse trouble whereby shall quietly serue god effectually pray grace right great offence shold merite pardon much rather taking case trust veryly yow doo body mvch weakened meny disease infirmity soule much inquieted trouble harte withdrawen god fro deuotion prayer wold veryly thinke lyve may long continewe wherfore estsoones besech moost gracious highenes charytable goodnes may deliuered besynesse onely prepare soule god make itt ready agaynst commyng death moore come abroode world mooste graciouse soueraigne lord besech highenes singular excellent endewments noble bodie sowle loue christ iesu soo dearly moost preciouse bloode redeamed yowr myn duryng lyue shall cease bownden yett entearly make praier god preseruation royall maiestie rochester xxvii day february humble beadman subiect io roffe writ likewise high court parliament sitting effect businesse fully finished another came vpon part anno hen ca oath supremacie refusing whereof tendered adiudged high treason oath part denies whereupon committed tower whence thus writes cromwell humble commendation ex lit bib cotton ye couet write vnto king highnesse good faith dread mee cannot soo circumspect writing sum word shall escape wherwith grace shall moued sum displeasure wherof wold veray sory answer god wold manner poynte offend grace duty saued vnto god must euery thyng prefer consideration full loth full feare wryte vnto highnesse matter neuerthelesse sythen conceyue mynd shall soo doo endeuor mee best first must beseech yow gode master secretary call yowr remembrance last befor yow commissioner taking othe concerning king noble succession content sworne vnto parcell concerning succession rehearse reason whiche sade moued mee dowted prynce eny realme th assent noble common myght appoynte succession royall order seen vnto wysdom accordyng reason sade content sworne vnto parte othe concernyng succession veray trowth god help sowl neede albeit refused swear parcel bycause conscience wold serue doo furthermor byseche yow gode master vnto necessitie haue nether shirt sute yet clothes ar necessary wear bee ragged torne shamefully notwithstandyng myghte easily suffer thei wold keep body warm dyett allso god knowes slender itt att meny tymes myn age stomake may away kynd meat want decay forthwith fall coffes disease body cannot keepe self health robert fisher lord knoweth haue nothing left vnto prouyde better brother owne purse layeth great hynderance wherfore gode master secretary estsones byseche yow haue som pittie vpon latt haue thyngs necessary mee myn age especially health also itt may please yow yowr high wysdom moue king highnesse take vnto gracious fauor againe restor vnto liberty cold painfull imprisonment wherby ye shall bynd yowr pore beadsman euer vnto almighty god euer haue yow protection custody twayne thing must also desyer vpon yow first oon itt may please yow may take som preest within tower th assignment master liuetenant hear confession hooly tym may borrow bookes stir deuocion mor effectually theis hooly dayes comfortte sowl byseche yow grant yowr charite thus lord send yow mery christenmas comfortable yowr heart desyer att tower xxii day december poore beadsman iohn roffe thus lay imprisoned great misery hungrie cold comfortlesse prisoner earnest suite king got leaue leaue office hee continued therein fully three yeares vpon last speech three daughter people present decollation thus one writes ne lugete meo confusae funere nataenich grudius ipse ego mutari non mea fata velim truncum terra teget si rex non abnuet vrnam et mea iam terris nomina nota volant libera men superos repetet neque seruiet vnquam partem hanc quod agat nulla securis habet tu quoque spectator tranquillum si cupis ae um exigere letho fortior esse tuo qui tibi membra cadan nullo discrimine pone quum sint naturae lege caduca suae another death way dialogue decease remarried shereman whose birth late writer thus sings putney place made blessed birth drayton legend great cromwell whose meanest cottage simply shrowd dearest english earth bringing poore village proud though time neuer lesse dearth happie wit yet mine well allowd best boldlie durst prefer breath acknowledged man actiue forward ripenesse nature ready pregnant wit discreet well aduised iudgement eloquent tongue faithfull diligent seruice incomparable memory reaching politicke head noble vndaunted spirit whose good part perceiued cardinal wolsey took straight seruice made sollicitor emploied matter great importance whose fall hee presently aduanced king seruice wherein industriously wisely demeaned himselfe thought worthie said king haue ordering weightie affaire whereupon seuerall time heaped seuerall office honour vpon made master iewellhouse baron cromwell okeham principall secretarie master rolles chancellour exchequer keeper priuie seale iustice forrests chase riuer trent northward great chamberlaine england earle essex knight garter vicegerent vicar generall fore remembred friend thus writes drayton first knighthood rising degree office iewellhouse lot rolles frankly gaue whence priuie counsellor got garter earle essex yet sufficient great vicegerencie grew title supreme new thus fortune raised short time sudden fall vpon eighteenth day aprill hee inuested honour earledome essex high chamberlainship england vpon day king also made sonne gregory lord cromwell vpon ninth iuly next immediately following enuied many honour authoritie suddenly drayton councellchamber place arrest chiefe greatest store speech noted best high oracle adore parliament lastly enquest selfe parliament tower hill scaffold last ascend thus greatst man england made end bloudie end men haue busie manager greatest matter condemned deathsome say act deuised cause owne death speed chap yet neuer came answere act said himselfe caused made foreremembred author drayton lawes made selfe alone please giue power freely euen equal hurtfull sundrie way forced thing doe say ill vpon violently seize lastly perish skill mine owne necke returning due heauie yoke wherein drew thus whilst striue suddenly rise flattring prince seruile tong soothers tirannies worke much woe doth many wrong vnto others tending iniuries vnto selues hapning oft among owne snare vnluckily caught whilst attempt fall instantly naught many lamented great man fall reioiced especially beene religious men fauoured religious person clergie much hated enemy poperie could neuer indure snuffing pride prelate thankefull hee liberall neuer forgetting former benefit appeares requitall kindenesse receiued friscolald italian merchant iohn fox drayton carefull seruants hee prouided competencie liuing interred highwayes side put passenger minde subiect mortalitie stow speakes fully thesesuruay bishopsgateward kindes funerall monument found field yeare saith hee lolesworthfield called spittlefield broken vp clay make bricke digging whereof many earthen pot called vrnae found full ash burnt bone men wit romanes inhabited custome romanes burne dead put ash vrne burie certaine ceremony field appointed purpose neare vnto citie euery pot ash dead one peece coppermoney inscription emperour raigning claudius vespasian nero antonius pius traiane others besides vrnes many pot found place made white earth long neckes handle like stone iugs emptie seemed buried full liquid matter long since consumed soaked found diuers vial fashioned glass cunningly wrought haue seene like christall water nothing differing clearnesse taste sauour common spring water whatsoeuer first glass oyle thicke earthy sauour supposed haue balme lost vertue many pot glass broken cutting clay taken vp whole also found diuers dish cup fine de coloured earth shewed outwardly shining smoothnesse beene currall bottomes romane letter printed also lampes white earth red artificially wrought diuers antique three foure image made white earth spanne long one remember pallas rest haue forgotten selfe haue reserued amongst diuers antiquity one vrne ash bone one pot white earth small exceeding quantitie wine pint made shape hare squatted vpon legges betweene eares mouth pot hath also beene found field diuers coffin stone containing bone men suppose burial speciall person time brittaines saxon moreouer also found scull bone men without coffin rather whose coffines great timber consumed diuers great nailes iron found vsed wheeles shod cart bigge man finger quarter yard head two inch ouer nailes wondred rest thing found many opinion men vttered namely men buried murthered driuing nailes head thing vnlikely smaller naile would aptly serue bad purpose secret place would lightly imployed buriall set downe obserued concerning matter beheld bone man lying noted head north foot south round thwart head along side thwart foot nailes found wherefore coniectured nailes coffin beene trough cut great tree couered planke great thicknesse fastened nailes therefore caused nailes reached vp found vnder broad head old wood eane turned earth still retaining graine proper colour nailes wood vnder head thereof reserued one also bone man teeth great sound fixed amongst many monument found haue yet shew nayle lying dry scaling greatly wasted thus much ancient funerall monument field certaine burial british late berne echon amydde heygh strete christenmen asle non alyue lete god yvor vpon cristendom persecucion ther hadde ther non yun monethe ther wer seuentene thou send mo martred lordes loue na ther grete wo wyth oute oder grete halwen hii heold longe torment seynt cristene seynt feye also seynt uincent fabian sebastian othur men rede heold faste fey hadde non drede among men londe ther wer many nec modico precio quem nonas decimas februo promente kalendas abslulit vltima sors et rapuit cita mors geffrey abbot gaue many rich ornament monastery challice couer massie pure gold afterwards hee thiss albans exempre lincoln deliuered monastery seruitude bishop lincolne controuersie long continuance end agreed vpon composition agreement confirmed alexander third bishop rome yeare bull purpose appearent bulla de compositione facta inter lincoln ecclesiam et ecclesiam beati albani alexander episcopus seruus seruoru dei dilecto filio roberto abbati monasterij sancti albani salutem et apostolicam ben ea que compositione seu concordia mediante rationabili prouidentia statuuntur sua debent stabilitate consistere et ne alicuius temeritate posterum valeant immutari apostolice sedis ea conuenit auctoritate muniri ea propter dilecte domino fili roberte tuis postulationibus grato concurrentes assensu compositionem que inter lincoln ecclesiam et monasterium beati albani super processionibus de herfordshira de quibus inter vtramque ecclesiam controuersia fuerat sicut instrumento exinde facto continetur vtriusque partis assensu rationabiliter facta est tibi et prefate ecclesie tue auctoritate apostolica confirmamus statuentes vt nulli omnino hominum liceat hanc paginam nostre confirmationis infringere vel ei ausu temerario contraire si quis autem hoc attemptare presumpserit indignationem omnipotentis dei et beatorum petrie et pauli apostolorum eius se neuerit incursurum dat auagn xi kal feb pontificatus nostri anno vij twenty yeares afterwards vpon new quarrel belike arising betweene two foresaid church composition transaction againe confirmed clemens third word clemens episcopus seruus seruorum dei dilectis filijs abbati et conuentui sancti albani salutem et apostol cam ben cum inter vos ex vna parte et ecclesiam lincolnien et capitulum eius ex altera controuersia verteretur super eo quod capitulum ipsum ecclesiam vestram proponebat ecclesie lincolnien de iure esse subiectam inter vos concordia de assensu partium intercesserit no itaque volentes que super causarum litigijs concordia vel iuditio rationabiliter statuuntur firmitatem perpetuam optinere et ne processu temporis scrupulum recidue contentionis deuenia literarum amminutulis memorie commendare concordiamillam sicut rationabiliter facta est et ab vtraque parte recepta et scripto autentico continetur auctoritate apostolica con irmamus et presentis scripti patrocinio communuimus statuentes vt nulli dat lateran id martij pontisicatus nostri anno secundo symon abbot caused many bookes written vse couent time one adam steward monastery made kitchin much large gaue money land couent monastery ideo saith author ob preclara eius merita inter abbates capitulo sepulturam meruit optinere therefore good desert hee deserued buried chapterhouse amongst abbot carine caused coffin shrine new made wherein put reliques saint amphibalus richard cordelion king england taken prisoner leopold duke austria ransome set one hundred thousand pound commandement directed iustices bishop prelate earles baron abbot prior bring fourth part reuenues towards deliuerance act reedified saint cuthberts chappell ruinous ready fall downe hee new made honour saint cuthbert saint iohn baptist saint agnes virgine vpon dedication caused verse insculped ouer high altar sororis bella prostrarunt villae medioque necarunt mors sic occisos tumulauerat hic simul ipsos postque necem requiem causauit habere perennem et medium sine quo vult hic requiescere nemo hic li hic part either taken away time stolne away brasse grauestones howsoeuer know well appropriate person intended yet lost labour take imprint manuscript paragraph reader may see rare composition age duplex est vita duplex mors corporis vna nominis paragraph astch altra miserorum mors ea dictum non sic hic obijt non sic hic nunc requiescit mo mors prima fuit illi vita secunda et si quod rapere voluit mors id tribuisse fertur quasque dare tenebras surripuisse estque lucet sic ei lux perpetue requiei atque libro vite quo nunc inscribitur ipse nomen eius legitur cum sanctis numeratur vpon prior house buried neuer beloued life time yet much bewailed death quem den momordit liuoris dummodo vixit linguaque detraxit mors nunc bene glorificauit nunc redeunt varia tumulata prius benefacta famaque recrescit liuor post facta quiescit nunc acus invidie lingue fel serra loquele carpere cessarunt nunc aicere sic didicerunt quando cadens obijt abijt pater hicque recessit secum dapsilitas secum virtu honestas istius ecclesie quasi plangentes abiere secum claustrale frenum que iugum monachale migrarunt eciam claustro dederantque salutem secum vera fides bine secumque sorores ibant ad puteum dixere locoque tuantem secum fertilitas pieta secumque facultas que parcit miseris sua que confert egenis secum iusticia pax lex policia breuibus quicquia virtutem gignere possit secum transiuit abijt secumque recessit cur dominus secum secum requies idipsum vpon monke buried church alter honestatis sol serens grauitatis hesperus ac morum lampas rutilans monachorum nunc occultatur hic sub modio tenebratur nec tribuit lumen claustro quod tribuit olim mors eclipsari cansauerat tenebrari est tamen eclipsis hee eius particularis nam sua seu prima nunc vita latet tenebrata altera sic lucet sic nomen eique resplendet quod per defectum nunquam patietur eclipsim nam per vim fame stat mortis vulnus inane cur exoretur pro patre pioque rogetur lux quia vera fuit subiectis dummodo rexit semper perpes ei lux luceat ac requici pausa sit perpetue vita vinat duplicique nominis ac anime sic vinere vult meruitque vpon monke abbey entombed quem natura mirum natu fecit generosum grataque sors dominum mo atque patrem monachorum nunc abijt sed non obijt quia nomine viuit nec recubat magi astch vigilat quia fama superstes vestitu maurus fuit victu benedictus pacomius monitis basilius rudimentis nec sibi defuerat ipsum decuit quod habere impar nam steterat pater absque pare pro pastore pecus pleb pro domino gemit omnis almaque sponsa flet cecidisse virum astra tamen ciuem letentur habere perhennem exultatque polus quod sit ei thalamus vpon monke house buried qui lacrimans lazarum revocasti quadraduanum ad vitam monachum reuoces sic hic tumulatum fac tecumque frui requie cum luce perhenni vendicat ex iure vixit monachaliter ipse vpon another brother couent interred iste pater pater iste pius pater hic tumulatus et pater mater pedagogus eratque minister dum rexit pecorum fuerat cur quod tribuendum quatuor hijs restat nunc detur eique reviuat voto fratrum quia tot fuit vnus eisdem stoque vice que modos alternauit variantes morte premi talem culpat pieta pietatem vpon iohn cressy young youth ancient familie cressyes hereby harding dum puer ipse fui puer libroque vacaui mortis mole rui moriens hic sepeliui here magnus eram preclara stirpe que natus dumque superfueram iohn cressy rite vocatus qui pretergrederis lege pro postque preceris vpon another young boy buried know que iuuenes que sene pueros que viros premit omnes mors sub mole tua precor te voce sub ista sit tibi posse breue nunquam fatum puerile per te mutetur sit canus cum morietur vi vndennis eram morsu cum mortis obibam dum mater plorat puer hic morte laborat dumque petra tegitur rogat vt requies sibi detur vt rogat ipsae sibi sit perpes pax requiei sic no clamemus secum pariterque rogemus vt sibi cum requie lux lucescat sine fine vpon thomas pakington slaine first battell saint albans swordbearer henry lord percy earle northumberland also slaine haue said lie buried saint peter church towne epitaph vpon marblestone effect vi prostrauit post mortem tumulauit hac sub mole petre perij seu sic periere tres magni domini fueram tunc scutifer vni portitor ac gladij pax sit eique mihi ipse thomas dictus pakington eramque vocatus vpon margaret biseworth maide qui legis hec memora iacet hic quod femina clara que margareta fuerat byesworth vocitata hanc mors seua nimis eta sibi dum iuuenilis infuit intacto steterat dum corpore virgo peste sua strauit hic stratam tumulauit semel x querno c quater ter sibi iuncto v que die binamartis decies repetita transijt seculo sibi propicius deus esto vpon iohn dunstable astrologian mathematician musitian musicus hic michalus alter nouus optandoque precetur perpetuijs annis celebretur fama iohannis dunstapil pace requiescat hic sine fine vpon one peter buried lower part quire petrum petra tegit qui post obitum sibi legit hic fine chori se sub tellure reponi petra fuit petrus petree quia condicionis substans solidus quasi postis relligionis hic sibi sub petra sit pax pausa quieta vpon one peter iones doctor parson successerit vllam eodem monasterio exerceat potestatem nec sui iuris ditione charter erkenwild nunnes ba king ex lib abb de arking bib co contra canonum decreta inquietudines aliquas facere presumat ea vero tantum faciat predicto monasterio que ad vtilitatem animarum pertinent ordinationes sacerdotum vel consecrationes ancillarum dei ipsa vero sanctum congregatio que propter dei amorem ibidem deo laudes exhibet moriente abbatissa ex seipsa sibi aliam eligat cum dei timore omnes terras que michi ex deuotionibus regum sunt concesse ad nomen eiusdem monasterij quemadmodum donate sunt ex integro et quieto iure possideant sicut chartule donationum continent quas presenti vobis tradidi et ne quis sorte improbus negator huius donationis erumpat ideo sigillatim terras hac chartula enumerandas et nominandas optimum duxi quarum prima c reckons vp mannors lordship donation monasterie particular concluding thus si quis autem episcoporum cuiuslibet dignitaris fuerit velsi quis omnium secularium memory writ downe came rochford thus runnes obscure barbarous rime curia de domino rege dictum sine lege tenta est ibidem per eiusdem con etudinem anteortum solis luceat nisi polus seneschallus solus scribit nisi colis clamat clam pro rege curia sine lege et qui non cito venerit citius penitebit si venerit cum lumine errat regimine et dum sunt sine lumine capti sunt crimine curia sine cura iurata thomas bullen king henry eight created viscount rochford afterward earle wiltshire whose progenie sprung gratious queene elizabeth baron hunsdon pritlewell foundation priory swein de essex remembred cannot seeme much impertinent subiect haue hand tedious iudicious reader anima domine lucie prime fundatricis ecclesie sancte crucis et sancte marie de heninghamlucie lady prioresse heningham et anime ricardi et sare galfridi et dametre et helene et anime omnium defunctorum per miserecordiam dei requiescant pace amen vniuersis sancte matris ecclesie filiis ad quos presens scriptum peruenerit agnes ecclesie sancte crucis sancte marie de henigeham humilis ministra eiusdemque locus conuentus eternam domino salutem post imbres lacrimarum et fletuum innundacionem quam transitu karissime matris nostre venerande lucie prime priorisse ac fundatricis domus nostre fudimus que vocante domino tertio idus iulij viam vniuerse carnis ingressa terre debitum humani generis persoluit manum misimus ad calamum vniuersitati vestre scripto denunciantes calamitatem quam patimur subtracta enim tam felici matre hac valle miserie simul cor nostrum dereliquit nosec mirum cum eadem tot virtutum polleret moribus tantis gratiarum rutilaret honoribus tot meritorum fragaret odoribus vt merito illi congruat hoc nomen lucia quod est lucis scientia recte ideo lucia dictum quia nomen beate virginis lucie sortita illius pro viribus imitabatur exempla illa meritis precibus fluxum sanguinis matre deleuit ista se omnis motus concupiscentie carnalis restringens fluxum aliis incontinentie contaminationis per ariditatem sancte conuersationis sobrie vite radicitus extirpauit illa sponso suo carnalem copulam nutu diuino subtraxit ista vt nouimus vinculo matrimonij septies constricta consortii virilis ignara incontaminata semper illesa permansit ita de laqueo venantium temporaliter est erepta et hoc fecit diuina prudentia vt nullum preter eum admitteret amatorem ista etiam discreta fuit silentio vtilis verbo verecundia grauis pudore venerabilis singulis compassione proxima pre cunctis contemplatione suspensa sicque studuit bene agentibus esse per humilitatem socia vt per zelum iusticie delinquentium corrigeret erratum vnde titillatione carnis ex ea didicimus habere prudentiam aduersitate fortitudinem tribulatione patientiam desperatione solatium periculo refugium estu refrigerium asperitate lenitatem et suit nobis ipsius exemplo lectio fr quentior oratio pinguior feruentior affectus quid multa tanta efflor hac benignissima virgine pia matre nostra virtu abstinentie tanta ieiuniorum vigiliarum nec non vestimentorum asperitate disciplinarum que assiduitate corpus suum extenuauit vt fere simul cum iob sanctissimo pelli sue consumptis carnibus o suum adhereret et hec talis tantaque sublata est et hec omnia simul migrauit autem ad illum qui sibi fructuum decimas persolui voluit qui etiam decalogum constituit mandatorum miseremini igitur nostri miseremini nostri saltem vos amici nostri et vobis miseris compatiamini fluentes lacrimas per orationum suffragia desiccantes quia pium est saluberrimum pro defunctis exorare vt peccatis solvantur subuenite igitur benigni monachi subuenite venerabiles canonici vos sancte virgines conspectu altissimi preces bostias offerentes vt ipsius pie misercatur qui abstergit omnem lacrimam ab oculis sanctorum quatenus que ei macule de terrenis contagijs adheserunt remissionis eius remedio deleantur amen supplication religious house answer forme titulus ecclesie apostolorum petri pauli sancte osithe virginis matris de chich anima domine lucie priorisse de hengeham et anime omnium sidelium defunctorum per dei miserecordiam requiescant pace amen concedimus ei commune beneficium ecclesie nostre oranimus pro vestris orate pro nostris againe answer thus preter autem commune beneficium et orationes commune ecclesie nostre concedimus ei ab vnoquoque sacerdote vnam missam inferioris ordinis vnum psalterium et diem ecclesie fidelibus salutem scialis quia concedimus et canonice hac carta confirmauimus quod ecclesia sancte marie de donmowe et fratres ibidem deo seruientes teneant ita quiete el pacifice et libere omnes illas elemosinas quas tenuerunt die qua rex henricus mihi roberto filio richardi terram dedit sicut vnquam quiecius et ho norificentius et liberius tenuerunt scilicet terris hominibus pratis bosco et plano et omni decima nostra et omnium hominum nostrorum eiusdem ville decima prati et pannagij nostri et decima molendinorum nostrorum et omni pastura eiusdem ville preteria sci ti quia concedimus et confirmamus quod predicta ecclesia et fratres eiusdem ecclesie teneant incrementa que no eidem ecclesie concessimus et dedimus scilicet duas partes decime dominij nostri de henham duas partes decime dominij nostri de northon duas partes decime dominij nostri de styston et decimam de passfeld et decimam de terra que fuit ernaldi le blache beruston et decimam de pachesham et essertum sanctorum quire church io blakemore prior vnder goodly faire monument body iohn blakemore prior dissolued house dunmow finde abstract chronicle monasterie lieth interred epitaph following composed subtus hic hoc tumulo recubat prior ecce iohannes de blakemor dictus vir probus atque pius peruigil implebat quod lex diuina iubebat eius consilium que fuit et studium debilibus dubijs cecis claudis peregrinis tectum pe oculus consilium baculu vespere et absconso machuti sole nouembris quindecimo hic moritur viuere vt incipiat ergo preces cineri dones quicumque viator ista preces tantum flebilis roberto radclif militi domino fitzwater vestri humiles et deuoti silij galfridus shether supprior et presidens domus siue prioratus beate marie virginis de dunmowe ordinis sancti augustini london dioc vestre fundationis et patronatus et eiusdem locus conuentus omnimod reuerencias cum honore orationumque suffragia et quicquid dulcius de latere crucifixi hauriri poterit vestre reuerencie innotescimus et certificamus per presentes quod bone memorie dominus iohannes blakemore noster iamdudum et dicte domus nostre prior quinto decimo die instantis mensis nouembris viam est vniuerse carnis ingressus et sequent prox ex tunc die ipsius corpus ecclesiastice traditum est sepulturex sicque sumus et est dictum domus siue prioratus prioris et pa oris solatio et regimine destitut ne igitur ex diurna eiusdem vacatione grauia nobis proueniant incommoda vestre reuerencie humiliter et deuote supplicamus quatinus cum sitis noster et dicte domus siue prioratus fundator et patronus vt prefertur vestram vt moris est ad noui seu futuri prioris pastoris electionem procedend ac iuxta canonicas sanctiones dei presidio celebrand patronalem licenciam nobis concedere dignemini cum fauore prosperitatemque vestram conseruet altissimus per tempora longiora dat domo nostra capitulari nostro sub sigillo xvij die predicti men nouemb anno domini millesimo quingentesimo decimo nono newton hallin hall mannor clamantis quam fortuna stabilis non permanet una exemplum cujus stat ordine carminis hujus rex agit et cronie tripart bib cot swanne duke gloc cognisance cygnus patitur de corde benignus ille prostratus non est de rege levatus ad plessye captus tunc est velut hostia raptus rex jubet arma geri nec eo voluit misereri cum sponsa nati lugent quasi morti gravati plusque lupo sevit rex dummodo femina flevit nil pieta munit quem tunc manus invida punit rex stetit obliquus nec erat tunc unus amicus regale genus princeps quasi pauper egenus turpiter attractus jacet et sine iure subactus sunt ibi fautores regis de sorte priores qui cygnum pendent vbi captum ducere tendent sic ducendo ducem perdit sine lumine lucem anglia que tota tenebrescit luce remota trans mare natavit regnum qui semper amavit flent centum mille quia cygnus preterit ille calisij portus petit unde dolus latet ortus error quem regis genuit putredine legis carcere conclusus subito fuit ille reclusus nescit quo fine sit robertus transgressor aqua nec enim quia transit sed precellit aquam cognomine credo notari est aqua lenis est aqua dulcis et est aqua clara mulcens albiciens emundans omnia lenis languenti dulcis gustanti clara videnti tu praecellis aquam nam leni lenior e tu dulci dulcior e tu clara clarior estu mente quidem lenis dulcis sanguine clarus tribus excellis aquam nam murmure lenis est aqua tu mente gustu dulciflua tu limpiditate nitens tu sanguine quodlibet horum est magi intensum procul te quam sit ipsa lyeth ion ione cressy who sowlys iesu hav mercy amen yowr cherite v al christian sowlys say pater noster aue lyue wer god sent v spase iohn ioan cressy yink hym grete grase body fase mor le must lik case piteous aray yow see nay sal ye self mak mon ye bin gon prey v wythout deley past dey may prey yow thus whylst yat yow mey nyght dey look yat yow prey iesu grase ye bin gon help ther non wherfor yink whylye hav spasesir edward denny knight ioan wife stand faire monument memory necessary appeares charter donation amongst record tower cart antiq li ego edwardus dei dono anglorum rex c haraldo comiti meo quandam terram antiquitus ab incolis istius locus waltham nuncupatam cum omnibus ad se pertinentijs ampis pratis sylvis aquis c sub conditione quod prescripto loco monasterium edificet memoriam mei et conjugis mee eadithe et insuper ornet diversis sanctorum martyrum et reliquijs et libris anglicisque vestibus et alijs ornamentis congruentibus ibique little couent frier subiect chanons rule catervulam quorundam fratrum canonice regule subjectam constituet plurimeque terre ut donentur monasterij illius extruendi usum et alimentum ipsius etiam haraldi cure et fidei commisi c name land particular many et hec omnia saith ad diluenda mea et antecessorum meorum peccata collata sunt quod si quis meorum successorum aliquam partem illius terre subtrahat vel subtrahi proinde requisitus emendare noluerit ei dominus justus judex regnum pariter ac coronam auferat c preterea volo et promitto quod omnia monasterij illius opem data vel danda sint semper libera et sherifs et hundredis et extra curiam sancte crucis omnibus placitis geldis c scriptum est autem istud privilegium ann dominice incarnationis mlxii indictionibus terquinis epactis septembris concurrentibus hijs testibus ego edwardus anglorum basileus confirmo et corrobero ego editha divini numine eighteenth yeare raigne king ed appeares patent following pat ed part ex arch turr londrex omnnibus ad quos c salutem sciatis quod cum non sit u set iam diu ab antiquis teporibus vsitatu quod inter ceteros officiales ministros quos principu lateribus pro coru magnificencia que gloria adherere decet eoru officij armoru cura comittitur copia habere debeat vt nec tepus belloru quibus ne que pacis sine couenientibus aptis ministris debeat preteriri no igitur cosiderationis acte laudabilia seruicia que delectus nobis iohannes wryothesley wrythe alias nuper dictus norrey rex armoru parciu borialiu regni nostri anglie hijs que ad officium illud spectare intelliguntur exercuit dirigentes eund propterea non minus ob solerciam et sagacitatem quas eo satis habemus exploratas principalem haraldum officiarium incliti nostri ordinis garterij armorumque regem anglicorum ex gracia nostra speciali ereximus fecimus constituimus ordinauimus creauimus et coronauimus ac per presentes erigimus facimus constituimus ordinamus creamus coronamus ac ei officium illud nec non nomen le garter stilum titulum libertates preeminencias huiusmodi officio conueniencia et concordancia ac ab antiquo consueta damus et concedimus ac ipsum eisdem realiter inuestimus habend occupand et exercend officium illud ac nomen stilum titulum preeminencias predict eidem iohanni pro termino vise sue cum omnibus iuribus proficuis commoditatibus emolumentis eidem officio qualiter cumque debit pertinen siue spectan et vlterius concessimus et per presentes concedimus prefato iohanni regem armorum anglicorum vt prefertur erect quadraginta libra per annum racione et causa officij illius percipiend eidem iohanni singullis annis durante vita sua pro vadijs feodis officij predicti de parua customa nostra portu ciuitatis nostre london per manus custumariorum siue collectorum custuine predicte portu predicto pro tempore existen ad terminos sancti michaelis et pasche per equales porciones vna cum talus liberatura vesture qualem et eisdem modo et forma prout aliquis alius huiusmodi rex armorum siue principalis haraldus tempore domini edwardi nuper regis anglie teroij progenitoris nostri habuit et percepit habend percipiend annuatim liberaturam huiusmodi eidem iohanni singulis annis ad terminum vite sue ad magnam garderobam nostram per manus custodis eiusdem pro tempore existentis eo quod expressa mencio de vero valore annuo premissorum seu alicuius eorum aut de alijs donis siue concessionibus eidem iohanni per no ante hec tempora fact presentibus minime fact existit aut aliquo statuto actu ordinacione prouisione seu restrictione contrarium fact edit ordinat seu prouis aut aliqua alia causa vel materia quacumque non astant cuius c teste r apud westm sexto die iulij per ipsum regem henry eight ye shall take oath ye shall obey first supreme head noble order knight namely thing shall belong office shall bee found reasonable ye taken priuie counsell bee taken ye shall sweare ye shall man silence true faithfull thing done shall wise disclose part thereof ye shall sweare also yee shall faithfully diligently fulfill performe execute thing shall committed put credit charge vnto ye shall diligently enquire noble notable act euery knight noble order yee shall certifie register thereof may better describe commend memory moreouer knight order die yee shall incontinent vpon knowledge thereof cause soueraigne knight aliue ascertayned thereof finally ye shall sweare ye shall truly faithfully vse exercise office god helpe holy euangely creation prouinciall king armes viz put aabout necke crowne head lastly bowle wine poured head calling name clarencieux norroy investimustunica armorum erigimuscollari coronamusappositione corone et nomen ei imponimus n oath king armes time shall crowned ye shall sweare oath ye receiued yee created herald faith ye owe vnto king soueraigne lord whose armes beare shall truly keepe thing bene comprised article following first whensoeuer king shall command doe message king prince estate person realme person estate degree condition bee within ye shall doe honourablie truly wit reason serue greatly aduentage soueraigne lord king realme true report bring againe highnesse message neere charge committed word substance said reason may attaine vnto alway keeping selfe secret manner motion saue person ye commanded vtter charge vnto secondly ye shall doe true deuoir euery day cunning office armes ye may bee better furnished teach office armes vnder execute wisdome eloquence charge soueraigne lord nobleman realme shall lay vnto vertue office highnesse elect time discouering wise ye charged keepe close vnlesse preiudiciall vnto king soueraigne lord realme thirdly ye shall doe full diligence haue knowledge noble gentleman within march beare coates field seruice soueraigne lord liuetenants officer commissioner issue truly register armes beare difference due armes bee giuen enquire hold seruice knight fee whereby doe king soueraigne lord seruice defence realme also ye shall truly indifferently note register fourthly ye shall strange teach pursuiuants herald ne ease doubt concerning office armes shall moue vnto cannot eased ye shall shew constable marshall pursuiuant aske doubt yee shall aske first whether haue desired herald instruct hee say nay ye shall limit one ease cannot moue said cause next chapter said doubt determined said chapter shew constable marshall also ye shall keepe duly march ye present precinct thereof chapter encrease cunning office armes doubt cannot bee eased ye shall moue vnto garterus rex armorum hostiarius ab atra virga nuncupatus ipsi cum suis tam rebus quam ministris suis officijs permanentibus sub perpetua supremi protectione ac propugnaculo secure durabunt vnde si quaevis injuria seu violentia ipsis inferatur vel ab eis qui supremo subjecti sunt vel externis quoties causa suas arbitrio supremi submittent ipse cu sodalibus exhibebit eis iusticiam aut exhibe dam ex aequo et congruo procurabit si vero par aduersa causam suam supremo submittere detractabit ipse cum commilitonibus eum erga officiales ho animum habebit vt ipsorum causam quoad iustum que aequum herus altus high maister officer great authoritie amongst romanes plurally called feciales faciendo quod belli pacisque faciendae penis co ius erat fediales faedere faciendo v word signifieth officer armes whose function denounce warre proclaime peace otherwise employed king martiall message businesse called internuncij vel pacis vel belli ferendi messenger carrie offer either warre peace heralt saith verstegan title honour office meerely teutonic duytch word tongue true aetymologie thereof onely found begin first syllable thereof though composition abridged true ancient teutonic word armie exercitus latine sence yet vsed germany whereas germanes doe vse also lord yet anciently vsed although teutonic mixed strange language yet word vse lord master hath crept language herus latine latine tongue became knowne vnto healt teutonick couragious person champion especiall challenger fight combat weapon sometime vsed called healtbard borne healt yet though corruptly retaine name holbard netherlands make heilbard herehealt abbreuiation heralt also herald doth rightly signifie champion armie growing name office hath armie especiall charge challenge vnto battell combat sense name herald frutecta quibus vt pueri virgam metuendo magistri se pudet id ferre vecorditer occoluere qui fuerant nostra proprius penetralia tecta ad no fugerunt sub stallis et latuerunt aut infra latebras timor holding hand violence time hee thus exiled went first vnto laurence archbishop canterbury finding little better case himselfe london departed france together iustus bishop rochester sent soone laurence happened yeare laurence died hee appointed succeed sate fiue yeares euen vntill day exspiration old anonimall manuscript thus whome melite playnly gan succede fyve yere rulyd chirche ryght concerning purifying pulling downe idolatrous church within kingdomes epistle well worthy obseruation haue read gotcelinus monke writes life action saint austin bishop see canterbury also diuers saint primitiue time dedicates workes anselme archbishop canterbury letter gregory followeth dilectissimo silio mellito abbati ms lib sim aurat gregorius servus seruorum dei post discessionem congregationis nostre que tecum est valde sumus suspensi redditi quia nichil de prosperitate vestri itineris audisse no contigit cum ergo deus omnipotens vos ad reuerendissimum fratrem nostrum augustinum episcopum perduxerit dicite ei quid diu mecum de causa anglorum cogitans tractaui videlicet quia fana idolorum destrui eadem gente minime debeant sed ipsa que eis sunt idola destruantur aqua benedicta eisdem fanis aspergatur altaria construantur reliquie componantur quia si fana eadem bene constructa sunt necesse est vt cultu demonum obsequium veri dei debeant commutari vt dum gen ipsa eadem fana sua novidet destrui de corde erroren deponat dominum verum cognoscens et adorans ad loca que consuevit familiarius concurrat et quia boues solent sacrificio demonum multos occidere debet eis eciam de hac aliqua solemnitas iramutari vt die dedicationis vel natalicijs sanctorum martyrum quorum illic reliquie ponuntur tabernacula sibi circa easdem ecclesias que ex fanis commutate sunt de ramis arborum faciant religiosis conuiuijs solemnitatem celebrent nec animalia immolent sed ad laudem dei vsum suum animalia occidant et donatori omnium de sacietate sua gracias referent vt dum eis aliqua externis gaudia re exuantur ad interiora gaudia consentire facilius valeant nam duris mentibus simul omnia abscidere impossibile esse non dubiam est quia et qui summum locum ascendere nititur gradibus vel passibus non autem saltibus eleuatur sic israheletico populo egypto dominus siquidem innotuit sed tamen eis sacrificiorum vsum quem diabolo solebat exibere cultu proprio reseruauit vt eis suo sacrificio animalia immolare preciperet quatinus cor mutantes aliud de sacrificio ammitterent aliud retinerens vt et si ipsa essent nimalia que offerre consueuerant vero tamen deo hec et non ydolis immolantes iam sacrificia ipsa non essent hec igitur dilectionem tuam predicto fratri necesse est dicere vt ipse presenti ic positus perpendat qualiter omnia debeat dispensare deus te incolumem custodiat dilectissime fili data die quinto decimo kalendarum augustarum imperante nostro mauritio tyberio pijssimo augusto anno nono decimo post consulatus eiusdem domini anno octauo decimo adest iustus dulces dans nomine gustus quintus honorius eccle vigor extat honorque deus dedit est sextus cui dat sua munera christus theodorus iuxta fert sabbata septimus alma septem ducibus viget anglia totque diebus additur octauus monachorum dux adrianus anglorum stella mildretha refert sua mella octo patres rome reliqui comitantur honore ex anglis nati meritis horum sociati hinc manat diuis euangelii via riuis hi sunt brithpaldus tatynnus vosque nothelme et iamberte patres primo proceres imitantes tot simul ecclesie cingunt frontem pictate lib ca written mellitus vpon certaine time citie canterbury negligence set fire began waste consume away much increasing flame helpe man casting water thereon able quench stay greatest part citie length almost burnt furious flash extending themselues euen vnto bishop place good bishop seeing man helpe faile trusting onely aide succour almighty god commanded might carried house set fierce flame fire piercing flying round greatest rage burning place martyrdome foure holy crowned saint whan bishop seruants brought forth set place began prayer sicke often troubled infirmity body much grieued gowte mellitu quenched prayer fire burning citie canterbury notwithstanding euer whole sound minde driue away perill fire stout strength strong men much labour could bring passe behold winde blew south whereby fire first kindled blasted abroad suddenly bent south first tempered blast feare hurting place right ouer side quite quenching flame ceasing extinguishing fire made calme well againe truly good man god feruently alway burne fire inward charity wont often prayer holy exhortation driue himselfe danger ghostly temptation trouble spirit aire might iustly preuaile winde easily cease temporall flame obtaine neuer hurt see canterbury ceada cedda death mellitus church london long without pastor euen vntill segebert sonne segebert surnamed little obtaining kingdome east saxon perswasion oswin king northumberland became hath thus written liud valiant veres men great command imployments longsir francis si ho ace vere song whose either marshall hand reacht highest wreath top get proudest head fame yet euer set returne diuine saith pitseus may know prologue storie thebe tale fiction hee constrained tell command mine host tabard southwarke found canterbury rest pilgrim went visite saint thomas shrine story first written latine geffrey chaucer translated lidgate english verse prologue owne making much concernes himselfe thus pilgrimes ley canterbury well lodged one know noti sooth may call hap fortune conclusioun befell enter toun holy sainct plainely visite sicknesse vowes acquite cope blacke greene palfrey slender long lene rusty bridle made sale man forne voyd male fortune tooke mine inne anone pilgrimes lodged euerichone time gouernour host stonding hall full wind bost liche man wonder sterne fers spake saied anon dan pers dan dominicke dan godfray clement ye welcome newly kent thogh bridle haue nother boo ne bell beseeching ye tell first name cuntre without shortly ye looke pale deuoid bloud vpon head wonder thredbare hood well arrayed ride late answered name lidgate monke bury fifty yeare age come toune pilgrimage haue promised hight haue thereof shame dan iohn qd well brouke ye name thogh ye sole beeth right glad light praying soupe v night ye shall haue made deuis great pudding round hagis franche dish made marrow grated bread moile tanse pancake froise monke slender couuremnet coise ye haue beene sicke dare mine head assure let feed faint pasture lift vp head glad take sorrow ye home ride v morrow say ye rested haue fill supper sleepe doen none ill wrap well head clothes round strong nappy ale nottie ale make man rout take pillow ye lye low need spare blow hold wind mine opinion engender colles passion make men greuen gu rops haue filled mawes crop toward night eat fennell rede annis commin coriander sede like haue power might charge rise midnight thogh moone shine clere selfe clocke orlogere morrow earely see time forth parcell afore prime accompanie verely parde shall doe good thus host cheared vp lidgate faire promise wholesome admonition health hee lay command vpon termes following looke vp monke cockes bloud thou shalt merry say nay morrow anone day ginne east daw thou shalt bound new law going canterbury toun lien aside thy professioun thou shalt chese thy selfe withdraw mirth found thy maw like custome company none proud dare deny knight squire knaue chanon priest ne nonne tell tale plainely conne assigne see time oportune purpose contune homeward custome vse thou shalt plainely thee excuse well ware study well night thou heart light thy wit shall sharper bet runne farre rime time returne scripsit partim anglice partim latine partim nostra speciali obsinceram deuotionem quam ad sanctam indiuiduam initatem ac dulcissimum nomen iesu gloriosissimamque dei genitricem mariam nec non omnes sanctos gerimus et habemus concessimus licentiam dedimus ac per presentes concedimus et licentiam damus pro nohis et heredibus nostris quantum nobis est dilectis nobis henrico hardman clerico thome ampe clerico richardo taxleo willelmo thewts clementi clerk ade newhawe et radulpho duke quod ipsi aut eorum aliquis vel aliqui executores et assignati sui seu eorum alicuius ad laudem gloriam honorem dei ac dicti dulcissimi nominis iesu quandam cantariam ac gildam perpetuam de vno custode societate capellanorum ac fratribus et sororibus de gilda illa esse volentibus diuina singulis diebus villa de bury sancti edmundi com suff ad specialiter exorand pro salubri statu nostro et preclarissime consortis nostre elisabethe regine anglie et precarissimorum filiorum nostrorum edwardi primogeniti principis wallie et richardi ducis ebor ceterorumque liberorum nostrorum nec non dictorum henrici thome richardi willelmi clementis ade et radulphi dum vixerimus et pro animabus nostris cum ab hac luce migrauerimus ac pro animabus willelmi cote clerici iohannis smyth nuper de bury sancti edmundi armigeri et anne vxoris eius ac pro animabus parentum benefactorum et quorumcunque fratrum et sororum de gilda predicta existencium seu esse volencium et successorum suorum et animabus omnium fidelium defunctorum imperpetuum celebratur aliaque pietatis et miserecordie opera iuxta ordinationes stabilimenta et constitutiones per presentes hen tho rich clem adam et radulph seu eorum aliquem heredes execusiue assignatos suos predict seu corumaliquos vel aliquem hac parte faciend factur ac subitur ac quandam mansionem pro eisdem custode et capellanis infra dictam villam de bury sancti edmundi facere fund erigere creare et stabilire possint et quod canteria et gilda ille cum sic sacte fundate erecte colledge dedicated honour name iesus create et stabilite fuerint cantaria et gilda dulcissimi nominis iesu infra villam de bury sancti edmundi com suff perpetuis suturis temporibus nuncupentur et appellentur et quod custo set societas capellanorum ac fratres et sorores cantarie et gildae predict et successores sui custos et societas capellanorum ac fratres et sorores cantarie et gilde dulcissimi nominis iesu infra villam yere mcccclx picture secular priest friere curiously limmed vpon parchment verse latine english good thinke good emprint language questio quis iacet hic respons nullus q quid tunc r est femina q cuiu filia tu michi dic r ed pri post con mihi fert sic cronica si memorem dedit huic hispania matrem q cognomen mihi da r de acris sic dictum iohanna q cur sic declara r quoniam fuit hec ibi nata hinc honore tuo vincenti pectore puro qua cubat hanc bellam fundauerat ipse capellam q nupta fuit nec ne r suit imo q cui r michi crede gilberto comiti gloucester q quis pater illi r nobilis et nardus redolens fuit iste richardus qui quos dilexit heremitas trans mare vexit ordinis egregij doctoris nomen et illi augustinus erat quos princeps ipse fouebat ob merita egidij dulcisque amore libelli quem de regimine procerum composuit ipse vt suus regno nouiter successeret ordo anglor hinc sit ei summe merces requiei q sedprecor ex latere fuit vxor que michi pande istius eximij quem effers sic laude ricardi r hec fuit iliustris domina et recolenda matildis que postquam sponsum mors strauit seua ricardum particulis nostrum varijs prius vndique structum auxit fundamen hinc merces ei detur amen q et que gilberti fuit vxor dic michi primo istorum heredis r preclaris si mihi credis ex vlstris nata fuit ipsa matilda vocata vt monstrant arma maiori picta fenestra ecclesie istius fabricam de puluere cuius munere magnifico fundarunt hij duo primo q num sterilis domina fuerat prefata iohanna r non set femineo ditata est germine claro q nomen da que michi r fuit elisabeth q fuit illi num sponsus quisquans r fuit imo q dicito quis nam r ex vlstris here dictus de burgo iohannes duxerat hinc iuncta qua sunt vl glou simul arma vt patet multis vitratis ecce fenestris capituli dormitorij refectorij que que loca trina suis fundauit sumptibus hec q quis muris adiecit tectum r sola omnia fecit q sanguinis egregij num rinulus affluit illis affluit hinc clara fuit elisabeth sibi nata altera que egregio post leonello ed ter innato post fataque sic tumulato vt vides exigua pro tanto principe tumba inque chori medio q sednum tam clara propago liquerat heredem r sic q quam dicas mihi prolem r femineam q quota fuit ipsa vocata r philippa que comiti edwardo le march data virgo marito rogerum genuit hic edmundum generauit edmundus sterilis obijt sine semine q iuris ergo cui titulus huius cessit dominatus r rogeri nate q cuius dic nominis r anne de cambrigg comiti nupsit quoque q filius illi num fuit r vt nardus redolens imo ricardus huic nascebatur patris qui iure vocatur dux eboracensis cuius prefulgerat ensis bellorum titulis gl riosis atque triumphis cuique natura donauit munera plura et fortuna suis hunc pinxit dotibus amplis gratia succurrat quoque longo tempore vinat felici vita virtutibus et redimita q coniugis aut solus extat dux hic honorandus r absit vt hic tantus princeps sine coniuge solus esset nam nephas foret q ergo michi rogo dicas quam duxit r dominam te scire volo graciosam q nomen de huius r extat cecilia q cuius filia declares fuerat r reor vltima prole westmorlond comitis sexus saltem muliebris quo non obstante diuino munere dante cunctis prelata sit honore sororibus ipsa q num sunt hijs soboles alique r sunt q dic michi quales r bi sene prole q harum nomine dones quomodo satate quo sint et ordinenate r post annos steriles multos fit primula prole anna decora satis sed post hanc stirps probitatis nascitur henricus cito quem virtutis amicus cristus arce poli fecit regnart perhenni prodiit edwardus post hunc here que futurus edmundus sequitur hinc elisabeth generatur post margareta willelmus postera meta fit pro presenti donec sua minnera ventri det deus hinc matris solite signum pietatis margret post prole hinc willelmus que iohannes quos raptus seculo statuit deus almus olympo inde georgius est natus thomas que ricardus thomas fata successit sorte beata vltima iam matris prole fuit vrsula regis que summi voto celesti iungitur agno q optime naturam pinxisti pande futuram si scis fortunam r dux excester net annam vxorem que come march est edward patris beres rotlonde edmundus come existit vocitatus tres reliquas prole solita pietate parentes tempore condigno titulabunt nomine digno istam progeniem soboles vtrumque parentem omnipotens firmet ast incolumes rogo seruet temporibus longis et secum viuere celis prestet post faeta ducens ad galmata grata conferat hoc flamen pater et prole precor amen translation latine number english stanzaes followeth seemeth haue beene composed one time appeares character question man lyeth sey sir frere answere man q elli woman q whose daughter wold lefe woll tell sir liche king edward furst aftur conquest began haue lernyd hir fadir spayn borne hir modir q name dame iohan hight acris q declarid wold sey furst world light borne hir modir cronicles telle wherfore honoure uincent singuler affectioun chapel made pure deuotioun q ought weddid ony wight yea sir q yf ricardis wiff thou preisest countes hereford mauld hight whiche whan deth knotte vndoo temporal spousaile bitwixt hem twoo diuers parcel encres fundatioun liche monumentys make declaratioun q furst londis whome stode wold fayne lerne might sir roger myddil erle noble knight tweyn doughtris lefte blode roial one issue deide othris hath al q hight lady whose issue grase lordeschip atteyne dame anne wy erle cambrigge wyff dede god graunte hem blys hir son richard yet liueth y duke yorke discent fadir hath marchis londis right modir q sole maried prynce mighty sole god forbede grete pite q hath wedded gracious lady q hir name prey telle dame cecile sir q who doughter erle uuestmrelonde trowe yengest yet grase fortuned hyest q ther ony frute betwix hem twoo yea sir thonks god ful incident prince bloud lye open euery suspicion extreame griefe ended dayes nineteenth day ianuary third yeare raigne henry sixth foresaid battell taking miserable imprisonment thus much harding symonis et centum mille dedere necem de vita thome rex motus corde dolebat symonis extremum rex dolet atque diem ira fuit regis mors thome mors set ab omni vulgari furia symonis acta fuit disparilis causa manet et mors vna duobus immerito patitur iustus vterque tamen illeso collo gladijs perijt capud vnum quod magi acceptum suscipit ara dei alterius capite sano fert vulnera collum cuius erat medio passio facta foro mile precipue reus est sanguine thome symonis inque necem rusticus arma dedit ecclesiam christi proceres qui non timuerunt martirij thome causa fuere necis iusticie regni seruile genus que repugnans symonis extremum causat vrbe diem corruit gremio matris thomas medioque natorum turba symon ense cadi thomam rex potuit saluasse sed illa potestas symonis ad vitam regia docet quem spiritus ante malignus edocuitque sua tunc fuit alta schola talia que plures furias per nomina noui que fuerant alia pauca recordor ego sepius exclamant monstrorum vocibus altis atque modis varijs dant variare tonos horrible strange tone vociferation balles roaring boyes rebel quidam sternutant asynorum ferino mugitus quidam personuere boum quidam porcorum grunnitus horridiores emittunt que suo murmure terra tremit frendet aper spumans magnos facit atque tumultus et queritat verres auget et ipse sonos latratus que ferus vrbis compresserat aura dum canum discors vox suribunda volat vulpis egens vlulat lupus et versutus altum conclamat que suos conuocat ipse pares nec minus sonitu concussit garrulus anser aurc que subito fossa dolore pauent rombuant vaspe sonus est horrendus eorum nullus et examen dinumerare potest conclamant pariter hir suti leonis omne que fit peius quod fuit ante malum ecce rudis clangor sonus altus fedaque rixa vox ita terribilis non fuit vlla prius warlike scot came vpon wing good order battell fashion like shield eagerly assayling enemy lacke good gouernment easily beaten downe discomfited without shewing great resistance corruerunt ex nostris white battell consisted many clergie men bishop died march hauing sate almost eleuen yeares sharing neare london whose body conueyed buriall owne church gaue two hundred pound order taken two monkes cellerers couent alwayes sing masse soule thomas piercy interred tho piercy bishop gentleman howsoeuer right honorably descended highly befriended yet constrayned admit bishopricke pope prouisorie bull followeth cum summus pontifex nuper vacante ecclesia norwicen per mortem willelmi vltimi episcopi ibidem paragraph qui apud sedem apostolicam diem clausit extremum eidem ecclesie de venerabili viro thoma percy prouiderit ipsum thomam episcopum locus illius presecerat rex cepit sidelitatem ipsius thome temporalia ei restituit teste rege apud west april pat ann ed memb bishop gaue vnto repairing church time greatly defaced violent tempest summe foure hundred markes obtained rest clergie great summe purpose bequeathed chaunter church house certaine land lying within lordship kimerle gaeriton fowrhow granthorpe wychelwood vpon condition procure masse daily said soule died blofield farre eight august vpon death bishop percy one henry despenser hen spenser bishop canon salisbury chiefe commander pope warres whose meanes henry obtained dignitie hauing changed vesture condition manner life spent youth delighted euen waxing yeares yeare memorable seruice stout bishop rebellious bondman pesants norfolke draue trench slew diuers caused mushrom king iohn littestar hanged drawne headed also caused others chiefe agent rebellion put vnto death meanes quieted whole countrey action two twentieth aug warned diuers refraine field insomuch night set forward toward king one wrote rime vpon gate hollins pa iack norffolk bold dikon thy master boght sold yet notwithstanding regarding oath honour promise made king richard like gentleman faithfull subiect prince absented himselfe master faithfully liued vnder manfully died great fame laud therefore though seruice ill employed aide tyrant beene honourable haue suppressed supported yet vpon fealtie vndertaken fight quarrell thought lesse losse life liuing glory honour might haue said respect loyaltie promised truth testified constancie death est mihi supplicium causa fuisse pium passage wondrously well deliuered v verse honourable late writer thus sir iohn beaumont baronet deceased poeme bosworth fieldlong since king
