lord shall spotlesse norfolke falsifie word mine oath past swore tvphold crowne shall swimme drowne late dispute right dare tongue since yorke spread forth light nort umberland buckingham defame two valiant cliffords roos beaumont name weaker quarrell die king haue euery eye face richard shunnes foule murder brother sonnes yet lawes knighthood gaue sword strike ioynt accord haue made prince tribute bring hate vice adore king victorious edward thy soule heare thy seruant howard deuoutly sweare haue saud thy child day hope earth willingly decay would glouster perfect faith tried made two graues noble hastings died said troopes order brings little giues v touch duke valour deciphers manner death matchlesse number follow valiant oxford fierce norfolke meete speares rudely greete aire shiuerd peeces play sword noble hand lay norfolke first blow directly guide oxford head helmet slide vpon arme biting steele inflicts wound vere disdaines feele lift fauchion threatning grace hewes beuer howard face done compassion charmd retires ashamd strike man disarmd straight deadly shaft sent bow whose master though far duke could know vntimely brought combat end piercd braine richards constant friend oxford saw sinke noble soule full griefe made thus condole farewell true knight costly graue giue due honour would teares might saue streames blood deseruing spilt better seruice richards guilt heauie weight vpon fortune laid thy glorious vertues sinnes outwaighd thomas howard duke norfolkesir thomas howard knight garter earle surrey duke norfolke sonne heire foresaid iohn thus slaine likewise entombed died sixteenth yeare raigne king henry eight thomas father forefront foresaid battell leading archer king richard placed bulwarke defend rest martiall prowesse earle pight field resolute braue carriage taken prisoner delineated life said author sir iohn beaumont particular wherof may seeme pleasing reading writing cannot way tedious set downe sinnewy strong liues draw doubt along couragious talbot surrey met many blowes begin fret one yong armes thus vnmooud resist strength oft warre approoud earle beholds father fall whose death like horrid darkenesse frighted giue themselues captiues others flie yong lion cast genrous eye mowbrayes lion painted shield king beast repines yeeld field saith lyon stand blood blood offer hand daring foe neuer shall flight dye blacke lyon yet white enemy like cunning huntsman striue binding snare take prey aliue desire texpose naked brest thinkes sword deepest strike best yong howard single army fight moud pitie two renowned knight strong clarindon valiant coniers trye rescue attempt dye surrey fainting scarse sword hold made common souldier grow bold lay rude hand vpon noble flower disdaining anger giues power erects weapon nimble round sends peasant arme kisse ground done talbot present blade saith hope life hath made submission strength spent perhaps villaine blood vent wearie soule fauour demand may dye victorious hand nay god forbid name quoth talbot put bright flame burnes thee braue youth thou hast errd thy father ault since preferrd tyrant crowne iuster side earle still mindfull birth replide wonder talbot thy noble heart insult ruines vanquisht part wee right flow fortune sword hath made neuer lucklesse choyce repent staine mine honour descent set england royall wreath vpon stake fight place forsake god hath disposd richmond brow crowne inclosd shall giue doubtlesse signes duty thought faction shine proued true whole course life depensild vpon table fixed funerall monument copie whereof hap haue originall much concernes subiect speake character moche wryttyn epitaphe aboute tombe present high myghty prynce thomas late duke norffolk discent noble antecessours declared wrytyng whyche also set armes tombe se farther manner lyuyng seruyce doon hym hys pryncis hys honorable depertyng world schall resorte loke thys table fyrst schall know seid duke hys yong age sufficient season gramer schole hencheman kyng edward iiii callyd thomas howard son heire sir iohn howard knight lord howard duke norffolke right enheritance seid thomas howard whan mannes age wyth dyuers gentleman englond sent charles duke burg n begynnyng warres betwixt kynge lewes fraunce seid duke charles ther contynued vnto thende seid warres hys greate prayse thankys well kyng edward hys souerayn lord seid duke charles warres doon betwyxt seid kynge lewes seid duke charles seid thomas howard returned englond vn kynge edward hys souerayn lord made hym immedyatly esquyer body aboute hym hys makynge redy bothe euenyng mornyng afterward made hym knyghte maryage duke yorke kynge edward hys seconde son seid kynge edward hys busynes aswell lyncolne shire feld tyme banberyfeld hys busynes also suche tyme kynge takyn erle warwyke warwyke befor hys escape departynge flaunders kyngys depertynge flaunders coostis englond sett ffor depertynge seruauntis frendis seid thomas howard dryuyn fforce take sayntwary seynt ioannes colchester true seruyce bare vn kynge edward seid kyngys retourne flaunders seid sir thomas howard resortyd vn hym went wyth hym barnet feld ther sore hurte whan kyng edward went fraunce wyth hys army ryall sent thether dyuers gentylmen seid sir thomas howard good experyence aswell hys beynge wyth charles duke burgon dyuers feldys busyness witthe seid kynge edward therfor commaundement go ouer wyth aduyse counsell tyll seyd kynge came ouer whan kyng edward kyng lewes mette barriars vpon ryuer som seid sir thomas howard wyth kynge edward barriars kyngis commaundement mo men saue chaunceller englond chaunceller fraunce sir iohn cheney kyngis comyng home englond seid sir thomas howard obteyned lycence kynge lye norffolk howsse righte lady hys wyffe called asshewelthorpe ther laye kepte honorable howsse fauor hoole shire duryng lyffe seid kynge edward tyme long lord hys father alyue kynge edward ded kynge edward fyfte son kyng rychard kyng forseid sir thomas howard hys subgette yonge duches norffolk whiche heire therunto ded withoute yssue lord howard father seid sir thomas howard rightefull heire former discent creatt duke norffolk creatt erle surrey serued seid kynge rychard truly subgettis durynge lyff lyeng home owne country kepyng honorable howsses went hym bosworthe felde seid kynge rychard slayne also seid duke norffolk thafforseid erle hurte takyn vpon feld put tower london kynge henry vii ther contynued thre yeerys halfe whiche tyme beyng tower kynge henry felde wyth erle lyncolne notyngham shire besydys newarke leeffetenant tower came seid erle proferred hym keyes goo plesure answered hym ageyne wolde deperte then vn suche tyme commaunded hym thether shuld commaunde hym ageyn whiche kynge henry vii charged leffetenant vpon hys alligeaunce yf kynge war lyue bryng hym ther kynge tente myght grace seruyce true feithfull seruyce seid kynge henry herd doon prynce also sawe hymselfe dide bosworth feld grete preyse truth herd hym whills prisoner wold nat thoughe liberty come tower erle lyncolnes feld toke hym presence aboute person wythin x wekes hys comyng towre ther insurrection northe erle northombrelond sleyne feld also citee yorke e saw e force subduyng rebells kynge assembled grete hoste hys subgettis toke iourney towards castell hertford seid erle surrey made chief captayn voward apoynted vnder seid voward erle shrewesbury lord hastyngs sir william stanley beyng kyngs chambrelayn sir rice ap thomas sir thomas bowser sir iohn sauage sir iohn ryseley dyvers whan iorney doon capiteynes rebelles many put execucion syngul r truste kynge seid erle activyte saw hym lefte hym north made hym hys lyve enaunt generall trent northward warden est myddle march englond ageynst scotlond iustice forest trent northward contynued x yeres kepte countrey peace policy many paynes takyng withoute yt wold nat countrey ben lately pony ed nat withoute desert thus dide hoole tyme x yere savyng second yere beyng ther insurrexion west part countrey whome seid erle helpe kyngs true subgetts fought feld subdued akworth besides pomfrett besides dyvers ayne feld toke capytaynes put execucion residue sued kyngs highnes ther pardones whiche obteyned wanne therby fauor countrey yere kyng went ouer see laid seege bolayn seid erle remaynyng ther withstondyng apoynted gone kyng h gone lightnes pepule ther wherfor left behynd sauegard countrey defendyng realme synguler truste vnto hym sone ther warre scottis seid erle wold redynes defende went annwyke ther laye defence border persone made wynter rood tyvydale ther brent ther howsses ther corne greatest losse empouerysshement countrey doon ther hundreth yere kyng scott owne person one par yn hym invaded realme englond greatre power laid seege northam castell assone erde seid erle comyng towardis hym deperted fled scotlond spede myght somer seid erle made another rood scotlond laid seege castell heyton dide race pull downe seid castell kyng scottis puyssaunce realme lokyng vpon erle nat past viii ix thowsand men hym kyng scottis sent vnto seid erle lyon herrold requyre batayle graunted seid erle saying vnto seid herrold forasmoche officer armes sent kyng master requyre bataile lyvetenaunt kyng master graunted thervnto said contracte full bargayn whiche cowde brokyn defawte oon promysed faith bare god seynt george kyng master wold fulfill promesse yf kyng hys master brake yt shuld asmoche dishonor reproche euer prynce whan harrold herd answere sawe weall said erle clerely determined fight said vnto hym sir kyng master sendeth word eschewyng effusion gristen blode wilbe contented fight hande hande towne berwike fisshegarthis west march yf wynne bataile yf ye wynne hym bataile kyngis raunsom whervnto said erle made answere thanked grace wolde put hym moche honour beyng kyng anoynted wold fight hande hande poore man yt seid wold nat dysceyve grace said though wanne hym bataile neuer nerer berwike ner fisshegarthys suche comyssyon comyssyon kyng scottis master harme coude wold c bad hym shewe vnto kyng hys master whan iorney wolde fyght wyth hym horsback fote hys plesur place wold indifferently appoynt yf kyng hys master wold gyff hym leue c whan warre doon ended witthe scottis north part englond good reste peace kyngs highnes sent seid erle agayn parson made hym tresourar englond priuye counsayll kyng sent hym scotland chief com myssyoner withe lady margarett hys doughter maryed foresaid kyng scottis whiche kyng att tyme seid erlys beyng ther entreteyned hym thankfully fauourably coude thought notwithstondyng anye dyspleasures doon hym seid erle warres also seid kyng said vn hym loued hym better suche servyce doon kyng father kyng englond thoughe hurte war doon hym realme gave hym depertyng greatt gyfts comyng home agayn seid erle truste kyng souerayn lord hym hys grace made hym one hys executours dethe kyng henry vii kyng henry theyght made hym lyke wyse hys prevay counsayll styll contynued tresourer englond made hym highe marshall syngler truste kyng aswell truthe hys wysdome actyvytte goyng fraunce puyssaunce havyng hys hyghnes moste parte noble realme lefte said erle certeyn power northe party made hym lyvetenaunte generall trent northward defend realme agaynste kyng scottys hyghnes truste vnto cause leeg betwyxt fraunce case kyng wold invade thys hys realme whiche dide deede contrary hys oth promyse hoole power realme scotlond whiche seid erle hard made greatt haste towardis hym coude kyngs power north party toke hys lodgyng campe playn ca yd wollar haugh countie northumbrelond ight kyng scottis hys army ying floddon hyll ground lyke campe forteres meete ground gyve batayle contrary hys promes made roge ra purseuaunte army sent vnto hym seid erle message said erle lord howard admerall englond hys son men north partis kyngs subgettis north partis come thedir represse resiste hys invasyons hys souerayn lordis realme desyryng said kyng scottis gyve hym bataile message kyng scottis toke thankfully ioyusly promysyng hym abide ther grounde wher whiche hys promys brake aforesaid tooke floddon hil y ground unprengnable shot hym hys great ordenaunce lay like one mynded kepe like forteres whan said erle dide perceyve brokyn hys promys takyn stronge grounde floddon hillys said erle remoued batail vnto playn besydis barmer wood thentente get betwene hym hys owne realme scotlond ther leygeed one nyght next mornyng e hys passage ouer water twyfull forthe marched said kyng hys oste suche maner gat betwene hym hys aune reame scotlond force wherof said kyng fayn leue campe prepare hymself bataile witthe seid erle hyll besydis bramston northumbrelond neer vnto sandyford wher said erle witthe good assistauns nobull men power said north party fought witthe said kyng hym anqu sshed slewe playn bataile derectely owne standard bataile ware slayne scottysshe parte ii bysshoppes xi e lys xvii baron cccc knyghtis besydys gentilmen xvii nombre ware nombred asweel scottysshe men dyd bury moste parte trouth dyvers gentylmen others aswell said erlys servantys north partyes chesshir lankasshir war ther slayne hard y half impossible suche conflicte bataile wonne without losse men whoys deth may ioyed among ther frendis dye hygh servys doon ther prynce noble acte helpe almyghty god highe honour kyngis hyghnes honor prays said erle noble men otheres kyngs subgettis war ther hym bataile ix daye septembir v yeer souerayn lord kyng henry viii doon said erle went barwyke establysshe thyngys well good order sent dede body kyng scottis barwyke whan ordenaunce kyng scottis brouth feld put good suertie thyngys good order seid erle toke hys iorney toward yorke ther abode duryng kyngis pleasur caryed hym dede body thafforesaid kyng scottis ther laye vnto suche tyme kyngis hygh e cam beyond see wynnyng tyrwyn tomey hys highnes sent seid erle mete hym rychemond dide ther delyvered vnto highnes dede body kyng scottis whiche de bodye delyuered charter hous ther ther abide duryng kyngs plesur servyce seid erle dide honorably restored vnto right name duke norffolk also geuen vnto hym greatt possessyons kyngis highnes whan warre betwixt kyng souerayn lord frenche kyng eended said duke sent fraunce chieff commyssyoner lady marye kyngis suster maryed vnto frenche kyng lewes kyng quene reame mete witthe frenche kyng frauncys guynes prynces remaynyng reame beyng childe said duke left behynde protector defender mynyster iustice see good rule gouernaunce reame absence kyngis highnes contynued aboute kyng preuye
